KABU!UR'RUK!ALTAR OF THE VOID!1.000!DESC.dialogue_text: As Eidos enters this chamber, she sees nothing, hears nothing and feels... nothing. It is as though space and time came to an abrupt halt at the edge of this portal. And though her senses tell her nothing exists beyond this gate, her Trueflesh knows better. Yet her 'awareness' and her 'Awareness' must first be reconciled, for some secrets must remain so until adequate preparation takes place.

A.response_text: Return to the Dungeon of the Void

KABU!UR'RUK!ALTAR OF THE VOID!2.000!DESC.dialogue_text: Stepping through the portal, Eidos' blood rushes groundward like a leaden waterfall. Deprived of oxygen, her mind begins to warp sound and vision into chaotic nightmares. Her limp body falls knees first, head subsequently colliding with the pitiless stone floor abruptly halting her descent. Lying prone against the cold surface, she breathes shallow, desperate breaths.

KABU!UR'RUK!ALTAR OF THE VOID!2.001!DESC.dialogue_text: Ever so slowly, blood flows to her starved mind, bringing in tow gifts of pain from bruised knees and cut skin. Laying one palm flat against the ground, she props herself up. Yet this hand is not the delicate and youthful one she knows; it is as though she has entered a withering body, pale and wrinkled skin peeling off to reveal large swaths of dry, coal-black flesh.

KABU!UR'RUK!ALTAR OF THE VOID!2.002!DESC.dialogue_text: Turning her attention to the surroundings, she notes that the space itself is a near-perfect hemisphere, its surface lined with a mosaic of sooty stone shards, each containing a pulsating spiral dimly glowing within. Countless spirals have been zealously carved into every last bit of the downward sloping floor, all forming part of a massive macro-spiral. Light, spirals and everything else converges at the center where an obsidian altar stands recessed deep into the ground.

KABU!UR'RUK!ALTAR OF THE VOID!2.003!DESC.dialogue_text: Her vision now begins to overlap with an older, deeper memory - though it feels no less immediate. She witnesses the cracking of a reddish wall and the discovery of the cell in which she stands: a great labor wrought by the fell hands of ruined beings. She recalls examining the altar itself, carved of a black rock so dark as to consume all light and admit no reflection. Its dimensions are dizzying and impossible to discern unless seen from all angles simultaneously, a paradoxical geometry beyond normal space and one only revealed or understood through the fusion of this alien recollection and her own perspective.

KABU!UR'RUK!ALTAR OF THE VOID!2.004!DESC.dialogue_text: Soon she compels maimed and misshapen beings - pale white yet covered in inky fluid - to kneel and supplicate themselves before the altar. They are made to bellow and weep a single word, a name, over and over: 'Hel'.

KABU!UR'RUK!ALTAR OF THE VOID!2.006!DESC.dialogue_text: Subsequently, offerings of blue, black and red liquids appear to be poured upon the altar, and yet there is still no response!

KABU!UR'RUK!ALTAR OF THE VOID!2.007!DESC.dialogue_text: Fury and frustration consume her mind like a black fog. She commands new, twisted abominations to vomit up colorless fluid upon the night stone; to no avail.

KABU!UR'RUK!ALTAR OF THE VOID!2.008!DESC.dialogue_text: A crushing sense of desperation and despair overwhelms her. She begins to cry as she laments not just her existence, but all existence. The foul creatures now kneeling before the altar look back in dread sensing their doom. Drawing upon all her Techne, commands the supplicants' muscles to contort their forms, ripping ligaments, splintering bones and ultimately tearing themselves asunder...

KABU!UR'RUK!ALTAR OF THE VOID!2.X009!DES.dialogue_text: In a flash, she is herself again, hands now covered by youthful, unmarred skin; those actions she witnessed were merely the dreams and memories of another - yet still somehow belonging to her. Suddenly, all emotions subside and Eidos is left with only emptiness.

A.response_text: Return to the Dungeon of the Void

KABU!UR'RUK!ALTAR OF THE VOID!2.010!DESC.dialogue_text: In a flash, she is herself again, hands now covered by youthful, unmarred skin; those actions she witnessed were merely the dreams and memories of another - yet still somehow belonging to her. Suddenly, all emotions subside and all spirals begin to synchronously turn in a nauseating dance; all but one large spiral, that is. This solitary static spiral embedded in the wall acts as a conduit to the tower beyond.

A.response_text: Return to the Dungeon of the Void

KABU!UR'RUK!ALTAR OF THE VOID!3.X000!DES.dialogue_text: Eidos looks upon Ormenos' sacrificial altar to Hel once more. It is as vivid now as it was in her waking nightmare, and the overwhelming weight of his memories press heavy upon her heart. The myriad spirals etched into the dome and wall appear to unflinchingly watch her from all angles. It is clear that this unrelenting place will consume her very Trueflesh if she stays.

A.response_text: Retreat to the Dungeon of the Void

KABU!UR'RUK!ALTAR OF THE VOID!3.900!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos looks upon Ormenos' sacrificial altar to Hel once more. It is as vivid now as it was in her waking nightmare, and the overwhelming weight of his memories press heavy upon her heart. The myriad spirals etched into the dome and wall appear to unflinchingly watch her from all angles. It is clear that this unrelenting place will consume her very Trueflesh if she stays.

KABU!UR'RUK!ALTAR OF THE VOID!3.901!DESC.dialogue_text: Suddenly, all emotions subside and all spirals begin to synchronously turn in their nauseating dance; all but one large spiral, that is. This solitary static spiral embedded in the wall acts as a conduit to the tower beyond.

A.response_text: Retreat to the Dungeon of the Void

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!0.X000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text:
Eidos plummets blindly into the reeking corruption of the abyss, her descent measured only in the accelerating beats of her panicked heart. With a squish, a heap of putrefied waste softens her fall, the vomit-inducing stench of which compels Eidos to contribute the contents of her stomach to it. Eidos extricates herself from the pile and now tries as best she can to remove the filth from her traveling robes and hair, but to little avail.

		Her eyes, now accustomed to the low-light surroundings, spy a speck of light, emanating from directly in front of her.

		Running her hands along the slime-sheathed wall, Eidos senses its tubular curvature. A gust of air rushes over her like a waterless river. Turning away from the pinpoint of light she feels the origin of this airborne stream flowing from somewhere deep within the darkness.

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!0.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text:
Eidos plummets blindly into the reeking corruption of the abyss, her descent measured only in the accelerating beats of her panicked heart. With a squish, a heap of putrefied waste softens her fall, the vomit-inducing stench of which compels Eidos to contribute the contents of her stomach to it. Eidos extricates herself from the pile and now tries as best she can to remove the filth from her traveling robes and hair, but to little avail.

		Her eyes, now accustomed to the low-light surroundings, spy a speck of light, emanating from directly in front of her.

		Running her hands along the slime-sheathed wall, Eidos senses its tubular curvature... and something else.

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!0.001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Her hand touches upon a face. As her night vision grows more acute, Eidos can dimly distinguish the filthy visage of Nakara, her glassy eyes now staring out from the sleep of death. Her presence here must be new as Eidos had seen her but some time ago - though how long ago she cannot seem to remember...\n\n\t\tA gust of air rushes over her like a waterless river. Turning away from Nakara she feels the origin of this airborne stream emanating from somewhere deep within the darkness opposite the pinpoint of light.

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!1.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text:
Every step through the festering sewage brings her closer to the sunlit aperture. The stench starts to dissipate as a dry wind is exhaled at the mouth of the passage up ahead. When she arrives at her destination, she finds her escape from the Cess Pit to be a hollow victory; for while Eidos finds that she can indeed see the outside world from here, the sewage outflow empties downward from an impossibly high precipice.

		Though the drop is sheer and lacks cracks or handholds of any kind, she is at least now permitted a view of her whereabouts: to her left is a distant, but apparently massive mountain range; while forward and to her right is a vast, empty flatland that seems to extend off into infinity; and finally, directly below are the ruins of an ancient twin city to the one she now stalks, terminating at the sheer cliff Eidos now looks out from.

		Though difficult to tell how high up she is, it is certain that to attempt such a leap in the face of guaranteed death would be little more than an act of blind faith - or perhaps just a misguided attempt at meeting her maker.

F.response_text: Attempt the leap of faith

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!1.001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Inexplicably, to her at least, Eidos feels compelled to push off from the edge.

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!1.002!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The initial exhilaration of her flight into the sweet air is short-lived, as it is replaced with excitement of another kind...

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!1.004!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Gripping her soul as she is summoned to the ground by gravity's call, she feels an utter sense of terror. Eidos' escape from the filth of the sewer is truly complete when her bones shatter upon the windswept buildings at the foot of the precipice...

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Passing the mountain of muck that cushioned her fall, Eidos walks a ways down the cylindrical passage. There are very few solid items strewn among the decomposing refuse, yet her feet somehow manage to find them all as they shuffle through the tubes, nearly falling each time into the bilious broth.

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.X001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: After some time - minutes or hours, for time disguises itself well in this hellscape - she begins to hear the sound of approaching splashes.

D.response_text: Stop and listen

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.0010!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: She stops, as do they. She kills her breath and centers focus on her ears, her only useful ally at the moment...

F.response_text: Stay still

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.00101!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Nothing... until, suddenly 'something' forms from the ether. An ever-brightening vision, both terrible and grand... Colorful plumage... A golden beak... The rays of a thousand suns... And then...

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.00102!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: A resonant caw! The most exquisite melody ever to caress her ears! Blinding light and ebullient sound crescendo in glorious harmony!

D.response_text: Run from the beast!

E.response_text: Attack!

F.response_text: Praise this magnificent creature!

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.001021!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Though light consumes all sight and cawing devours all sound, Eidos yells out her hail to the shade-born vision, but finds confusion where she had hoped for communication...

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.001022!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Ever curious, Eidos strains her eyes and ears against the sensory overload, lusting for a tiny sip of knowledge's sweet nectar to slake a thirst unquenched. Alas! She tastes instead from the bitter draught of disappointment...

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.001023!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Eidos steels her concentration. Alone in darkness, fears and insecurities abound. Madness is inevitable. But not for her. Her noncommittal nature lays bare the truth, makes obvious the origin of this vision of insanity. She will neither accept nor reject the vision and thus, gain power over it...

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.001024!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Terror bubbles to the surface, eyes shut reflexively and muscles tense. In a burst of movement she flees the unholy site of this unholy sight. Dashing, dancing, prancing, splashing, she flees. Running so hard, so fast, surely she must be halfway to the moon by now. She opens her eyes. She remains at the origin of her path, unmoving, not a single step's distance from the grotesque being!\n\n        Fear begins to melt her spine...

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.001025!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Fearlessly, Eidos stares the beast down, murderous rage filling her eyes. She opens her mouth and a mighty war cry pours forth, clashing with the being's caw in a cataclysmic cacophony. Her exact motivations for aggression are unclear, even to herself. But violence is motive enough for itself. If ever there were a true infinity it is violence! For violence begets violence! Rage fuels rage! Unbridled! Unbounded!\n\n        She races towards the vision, eager to learn what happens when an unstoppable force meets and immovable object...

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.001026!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Adopting the customary posture of salute, Eidos pays tribute to the God of her choosing. Oh, what adventures they've shared! And oh, what adventures await them! Roostor smiles upon her, contorting Its beak into a rather unavian shape. But then, with a flex of a wing and an awkward wink...

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.00103!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The light and sound instantly and utterly vanish - the being along with it. Not a trace of Its visit remains, save Its melodious call, yet ringing in memory...

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.00104!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Eidos shifts her feet in the muck, stumbling on a rare solid artifact among the refuse. Her hands fly out to cushion her fall. What they find instead of floor is wall, the tunnel's end. Her touch causes the cold surface to warm, then to glow, revealing a Glyph - unknown to her, or forgotten. Though, its light soon dies as it returns to a watchful slumber.

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.0011!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: She moves again and the splashing begins anew. She hesitates, but soon continues. Stumbling on a rare solid artifact among the muck, her hands fly out to cushion her fall. What they find instead of floor is wall, the tunnel's end. Her touch causes the cold surface to warm, then to glow, revealing a Glyph - unknown to her, or forgotten. Though, its light soon dies as it returns to a watchful slumber.

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.0012!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Passage blocked, she has but a single choice - no choice at all, it could be said.

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.002!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: After some time - minutes or hours, for time disguises itself well in this hellscape - she begins to hear fluid dripping onto a solid floor, one clearly well below the passage she now walks. Searching the floor with her foot, Eidos feels the edge of an opening, the width of the tube, but length unknown. She peers down into the pitch blackness, but sees nothing. From the echo, though, she can tell that the floor is within safe jumping distance - that is if it is ever indeed safe to leap into darkness...

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.003!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Staring out across the gaping hole and into the lightless subterranean passage, Eidos sees a familiar woman walking away. Slowly and deliberately, she marches, her steps punctuated by water splashing and muck oozing around her feet. Overlapping memories from another life, the reunion of forking paths, all comes together to form a single actuality from the myriad potentials. The results are singular, yet the way to them nearly infinite...

KABU!UR'RUK!CESS PIT!2.004!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: But still, much is left undone, and Eidos once again reaffirms her current reality above all others.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!1.X000!D.dialogue_text: Eidos enters a chamber bereft of all light. Cold, stagnant, utterly frozen in time. Suddenly, she is gripped by a feeling of displacement, as though her physical perceptions, bodily limitations and all their definitions are no longer her own.\n\n\t\tShe feels her awareness step forth from her body, siphoned away by the space beyond...

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!1.001!DE.dialogue_text:
In this waking dream, her form is shrouded in a blue cloak, making it impossible to identify the Trueflesh behind these memories. Nevertheless, a companion dressed in a green hood and traveling robe is clearly visible at her side - even in spite of the absolute darkness.

		They walk the chamber with eyes that seem to parse the darkness, revealing the dungeon's shape and dimensions while its detail and definition remain obscured. Before them is a flickering image, like a sculpture carved in a frozen, colorless fire that drops its tenuous shadow from higher dimensions.

		It is, in form, a female, casting a sightless stare upon the two as they advance towards her grim throne. She is flanked by a single attendant: a small child of indeterminate sex, with an invisible emerald aura about it.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!1.X100!D.dialogue_text: The rotten stench of centuries of stagnant air mixed with decades of accumulated sewage brings Eidos back to her senses. Scanning the void she now faces, her Awareness becomes bolstered by the vision. She can sense the grim hall before her and the now familiar presence at its furthest reaches.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!2.000!DE.dialogue_text: The gray shade rises from her dark throne, her first footfall reverberating across the space of Eidos' blinded awareness. The span between them begins to compress with each of Ark's subsequent steps, drawing the two fated heroines together like opposing poles. Until finally, Ark's presence occupies the entirety of Eidos' awareness...

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!2.001!DE.dialogue_text: The gray shade rises from her dark throne, her first footfall reverberating across the space of Eidos' blinded awareness. The span between them begins to compress with each of Ark's subsequent steps, drawing the two fated heroines together like opposing poles.\n\n\t\tLittle time remains, as Eidos' destiny draws near.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!2.0010!D.dialogue_text: In a frenzied panic, Eidos scampers into the darkened depths lying outside her awareness. Without the light of Biracul's memory to guide her in this place, she wanders blindly. More than a few times, she crashes against pillars or walls, and scrapes against strange and unseen formations of stone, all while the ripples of Ark's approaching stride pulsate around her.\n\n\t\tAbruptly, her consciousness is fixed by a voice. Echoing among the twisting stone, it unfolds across her mind until the vague and amorphous sharpen, forming a clear image. It is a Glyph of Discipline directing an escape from this dungeon, yet promising nothing else.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!2.002!DE.dialogue_text: The gray shade rises from her dark throne, her first footfall reverberating across the space of Eidos' blinded awareness. The span between them begins to compress with each of Ark's subsequent steps, drawing the two fated heroines together like opposing poles.\n\n\t\tLittle time remains, as Eidos' destiny draws near.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!2.0020!D.dialogue_text: In a frenzied panic, Eidos scampers into the darkened depths lying outside her awareness. Without the light of Biracul's memory to guide her in this place, she wanders blindly. More than a few times, she crashes against pillars or walls, and scrapes against strange and unseen formations of stone, all while the ripples of Ark's approaching stride pulsate around her.\n\n\t\tAbruptly, her consciousness is fixed by two voices. Echoing among the twisting stone, they unfold across her mind until the vague and amorphous sharpen, forming a clear image. They are Glyphs of Awareness revealing two paths from this dungeon - one promises a transient safety in the light; whereas the other makes bold claims of long forgotten secrets buried amidst the shadows...

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!3.000!DE.dialogue_text:
Eidos stumbles into a familiar darkness; the dark dweller Ark of Dazil awaits as her hellish companion.

		Upon hearing Eidos' thudding collision with the floor, the gray shade rises from her dark throne to confront the fated deposer. Ark's first footfall reverberates across the space of Eidos' blinded awareness. The span between them begins to compress with each of Ark's subsequent steps, drawing the two fated heroines together like opposing poles.

		Little time remains, as Eidos' destiny draws near.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!3.001!DE.dialogue_text: In a frenzied panic, Eidos scampers into the darkened depths lying outside her awareness. Without the light of Biracul's memory to guide her in this place, she wanders blindly. More than a few times, she crashes against pillars or walls, and scrapes against strange and unseen formations of stone, all while the ripples of Ark's approaching stride pulsate around her.\n\n\t\tAbruptly, her consciousness is fixed by two voices. Echoing among the twisting stone, they unfold across her mind until the vague and amorphous sharpen, forming a clear image. They are Glyphs of Awareness revealing two paths from this dungeon.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!3.0010!D.dialogue_text: Eidos rushes towards the dimming sound of Awareness' call only to slam into a wall. This was once the path which led her to freedom, yet it seems reluctant - or perhaps unable - to repeat the favor. The sealing of the portal upon her previous exodus and the frightening knowledge of what lies within this desecrated place was not enough to deter her from returning. Perhaps a second escape would only delay the inevitable reckoning that now awaits.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!102.000!.dialogue_text: Ark lies on the dungeon floor, her form fading from view like the afterimage of an extinguished, yet still smoldering torch. Her body is now made visible only by the glow of Luin's edge, the very instrument that cut the Trueflesh from its former wielder.\n\n\t\tAs the ghelblade returns to dormancy, Eidos is plunged into absolute darkness. Her senses annihilated, a dawning awareness awakens within the yawning void. A presence made palpable by negation, only perceptible as a shadow among shadows. This silhouette of twisted absence spirals at the edges of her mind...

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!102.001!.dialogue_text: She now understands that the undistilled essence of this Thing has already permeated her form. Terror grips her as she cries out in despair.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!102.003!.dialogue_text: Eidos is nothing but an empty shell.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!102.0090.dialogue_text: A serpent, eyes in the dark, a rushing maw.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!102.0091.dialogue_text: The sea of shadows heaves with the coils of the slithering leviathanic beast. Her flesh is awakened by pain from the ravenous Wolf's bite. These others now appear at the forefront of her mind's eye. The Thing becomes entangled in the knots Jormungund ties around it. It struggles, to no avail, and only tightens the great serpent's constricting body. And in perfect synergy, Fenrir emerges from the Graylands to sate his hunger. Chomping, swallowing, gnawing, crushing, he consumes. However, he fills his bottomless belly without satisfaction. Eidos yet senses his desire for prey of a higher order. The wolf's cold eyes stare at Eidos as he re-enters her mindspace to await his ultimate quarry.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!102.0095.dialogue_text: She is Eidos once more and the ordeal is now over - though her journey is not.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!102.X011.dialogue_text: Eidos, now calm, perceives the environment around her and in so doing, senses the presence of two Glyphs of Awareness revealing two paths from this dungeon - one promises a transient safety in the light; whereas the other makes bold claims of long forgotten secrets buried amidst the shadows...

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!102.011!.dialogue_text: Eidos, now calm, perceives the environment around her and in so doing, senses the presence of two Glyphs of Awareness and the passages they conceal. However, one of the Glyphs sounds to her more like a dying scream. It fades to silence and then to memory. Now, a single voice remains.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!102.012!.dialogue_text: Eidos, now calm, perceives the environment around her and in so doing, begins to feel the resonance of her Sigil with the Glyph of Discipline at the far end of the dungeon.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!102.013!.dialogue_text: With the solitude and solemnity of the surroundings, Eidos has a moment to reflect on her current circumstances. Without thought, she takes her place upon Ark's throne. With Luin at her side, the demonic void is guarded as it had once been by Ark.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!102.014!.dialogue_text: But this could not possibly be her end. This cannot be her fate.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!102.015!.dialogue_text: For Eidos, or something within her, feels her awareness gently drifting off into the sea of infinity, until she is no longer able to distinguish herself from the surrounding darkness. Until life is but a...

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!103.000!.dialogue_text: Ark lies on the dungeon floor, her form fading from view like the afterimage of an extinguished, yet still smoldering torch. Her body is now made visible only by the glow of Luin's edge, the very instrument that cut the Trueflesh from its former wielder.\n\n\t\tAs the ghelblade returns to dormancy, Eidos is plunged into absolute darkness. Her senses annihilated, a dawning awareness awakens within the yawning void. A presence made palpable by negation, only perceptible as a shadow among shadows. This silhouette of twisted absence spirals at the edges of her mind...

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!103.001!.dialogue_text: She now understands that the undistilled essence of this Thing has already permeated her form. Terror grips her as she cries out in despair.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!103.003!.dialogue_text: Eidos is nothing but an empty shell.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!110.000!.dialogue_text: This, the Dungeon of the Void - former abode of Hel's Keeper, Ark - now lies abandoned. In another time, this place would host the terrors of the past, yet Eidos sense that she has already affected reality beyond her ability to reconcile. Unfortunately, however, she finds herself stuck in this dungeon, as her only means of exiting looms far above her, beyond her reach. This journey ends here.\n\n\t\tHer Trueflesh, however, is more reluctant to surrender to entropy. Instead, it seeks a familiar scent left behind a past tenant of this gloomy prison...

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!110.001!.dialogue_text: This, the Dungeon of the Void - former abode of Hel's Keeper, Ark - now lies abandoned. In another time, this place would host the terrors of the past, yet Eidos sense that she has already affected reality beyond her ability to reconcile.\n\n\t\tAbruptly, her consciousness is fixed by a voice; echoing among the twisting stone, it unfolds across her mind until the vague and amorphous sharpen, forming a clear image. It is a Glyph of Discipline directing an escape from this dungeon.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!110.002!.dialogue_text: This, the Dungeon of the Void - former abode of Hel's Keeper, Ark - now lies abandoned. In another time, this place would host the terrors of the past, yet Eidos sense that she has already affected reality beyond her ability to reconcile.\n\n\t\tAbruptly, her consciousness is fixed by two voices; echoing among the twisting stone, they unfold across her mind until the vague and amorphous sharpen, forming a clear image. They are Glyphs of Awareness revealing two paths from this dungeon - one promises a transient safety in the light; whereas the other makes bold claims of long forgotten secrets buried amidst the shadows.

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.000!AR.dialogue_text: "The end it is then, if now your face I look upon. For was that not our pact, Shining One?"

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.X0000!.dialogue_text: "And what doom grips the world without, that would you and the Emerald Architect together bring? No second-coming of Rikharr, I presume..."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.000!BI.dialogue_text: "Nay. More years you must wait, I fear, as the end is not yet come - or if it be, then it has passed unknown to us and we are as shades to the Beyond."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.0000!B.dialogue_text: "And what doom, ask you? Naught but the passing of time, Ark. For even we unhappy few are as servants to its ceaseless march."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.X0001!.dialogue_text: "And time has unspooled events more vexatious than Rikharr - more unfathomable as well. We are not strong enough to best them."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.001!AR.dialogue_text: "Time? It passes not for me, Shining One."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.0010!A.dialogue_text: "For was it not you who told me I would be as a still stone in its stream?"

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.0012!A.dialogue_text: "No moon to tell the passing of the night, nor sun the coming of the day. No stars to point true north, nor winds to herald seasons..."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.0013!A.dialogue_text: "I am nothing in this timeless prison."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.0014!A.dialogue_text: "The companionship of green is all that sustains me here."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.X0015!.dialogue_text: "Yet memory wanes with my ghost in tandem; and my sole benefactor is at once my greatest malefactor; for Vanargand, your children plague me and comfort me in turn..."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.000!VA.dialogue_text: "You say that, even as you abide here with the fruits of my labors..."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.001!VA.dialogue_text: "You know it well; my children do not wither on the vine as those born of the spiral."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.002!VA.dialogue_text: "But old is this argument, and too weary am I for its defense now."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.X001!B.dialogue_text: "Indeed, Ark. It is regarding Vanargand's first child that we have come to speak: we ask that Luin come with us."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.002!AR.dialogue_text: "So it is not enough that I sacrifice my eternal Trueflesh, I must surrender my sole companion as well?"

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.0020!A.dialogue_text: "How much more will the Path of Awareness demand of me, Shining One? Will next it be my memories? Perhaps my name?"

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.0021!A.dialogue_text: "Do you wish for a ghostless husk to guard the Door of Night?"

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.002!BI.dialogue_text: "Nay. You have sacrificed much, Ark; and you need not say yes."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.0020!B.dialogue_text: "We recognize that Luin's companionship is yours; and even Vanargand blesses your friendship."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.0021!B.dialogue_text: "I ask this of you as a..."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.0023!B.dialogue_text: "In truth, I fear I must violate our contract, Ark."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.X0024!.dialogue_text: "If the end does approach us, I will not live to see it, as this work will be my last."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.003!AR.dialogue_text: "But... who then shall bring forth the final sunset before the eternal dawn?"

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.003!BI.dialogue_text: "Hope compels me to think it untrue, but this is left to Eidos..."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!0.0030!B.dialogue_text: "You will know her if she returns with your weapon..."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!1.001!AR.dialogue_text: "If what I guard is unknown to you..."

KABU!UR'RUK!DUNGEON OF THE VOID!1.002!AR.dialogue_text: "...then you are unfit to claim it."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.X000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Eidos steps into the decaying shell of a once proud structure. Gray light from the cloudless Wasteland sky filters through gaping holes in the scant remains of a high-vaulted ceiling. These meager rays illuminate motes of dust as they float through the air at glacial speeds.\n\n\t\tIt looks as though this place may once have mirrored the Hall of Vanargand, as it is similarly festooned with alcoves for statues. However, the statues within are completely unrecognizable, having been rendered into nothing but misshapen stumps of rock.

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.001!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Prominent among the drab surroundings, a shimmering, emerald-green fountain stretches several stories high. Its sheen suggests a metallic construction, but its resilience and lack of corrosion defy this conclusion. Rather, it looks to be cut from dimly luminescent jade and sculpted into the shape of some leafy, unfolding plant, caught between the worlds of nature and artifice. A small stream of coppery water trickles from its blossoms, staining the fountain's surface.

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.002!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Her eyes follow this sullied flow down to a wide yet shallow pool where its journey ends. To her surprise, this visual excursion likewise brings her to the elderly man sitting at the fountain’s edge, not too distant from the coppery flow. In this room of fossilized inanimation, he seems almost an intruder, soon to be swept aside by the tide of oblivion - or if not, then assimilated into it.

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.010!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Circumnavigating the immense fountain, Eidos reaches the side hidden in the font's imposing shadow. There, embedded in the cracked flagstones is a weathered metal cap. Shining gouges in its sides reveal that it has been recently pried up.

A.response_text: Go back and talk to old man

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.X0100!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Succumbing to an irresistible temptation, Eidos removes the cover... and is subsequently greeted by a violent stink. Some perverse and demonic combination of rotting meat with a pinch of raw sewage, truly this is a bouquet not even a sewer rat could survive. If she tarries too long, she will undoubtedly be ignobly found unconscious and basting in her own vomit near this cess pit.

A.response_text: Go back and talk to old man

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.011!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Circumnavigating the immense fountain, Eidos reaches the side hidden in the font's imposing shadow. There, embedded in the cracked flagstones is a weathered metal cap. Shining gouges in its sides reveal that it has been recently pried up.

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.X0101!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Succumbing to an irresistible temptation, Eidos removes the cover... and is subsequently greeted by a violent stink. Some perverse and demonic combination of rotting meat with a pinch of raw sewage, truly this is a bouquet not even a sewer rat could survive. If she tarries too long, she will undoubtedly be ignobly found unconscious and basting in her own vomit near this cess pit.

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.050!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Eidos has returned to the Emerald Font. The empty alcoves and ravaged archways loom overhead as the twisting fountain trickles forth its undrinkable offering. Radan has departed from this place and only Eidos defiles entropy's solemn chorus of inanimate ruin with her life.

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.500!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Scanning the broken plaza, Eidos sees two exits from this place: one, the high archway leading back to the Hall of Vanargand and an audience with Hazanna; the other, a perilous doorway on the verge of collapse leading outdoors.

A.response_text: The door the old man was staring at

B.response_text: Back to the Hall of Vanargand

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.600!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Eidos quickly replaces the cover while gagging up a modicum of bile from her revolted innards. Unintentionally, she adds more filth to the well before the lid seals away the horrific rot of whatever jinncursed thing lay in the bowels of the well.\n\n\t\tDesiring a change of scenery before being forced to taste for a second time the contents of her stomach, Eidos walks towards...

A.response_text: The door the old man was staring at

B.response_text: Back to the Hall of Vanargand

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!1.X000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: As Eidos approaches the elderly man, he continues to stare off absently into space; yet he is clearly aware of her, as he bends his ear in her direction.

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!1.X001!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Never facing her, the old man makes his demands. He has clearly been robbed of the light - and for quite some time at that, given the naturalness with which he has replaced sight with sound.

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!1.900!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Radan, having no more business here, departs to await his fate in solitude. This leaves Eidos with nothing to do but find greener pastures elsewhere.

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!10.X000!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Dysmas elegantly glides towards a well behind the enormous fountain, uncovering it and releasing a powerful aroma reminiscent of rotting produce and curdled milk. Seemingly unaffected by the putrid stench, he beckons Eidos, so that he might share his secrets with her. She obliges.

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!10.001!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Eidos strains her eyes to make out Dysmas' ladder, but cannot quite coax the fuzzy darkness to coalesce into a clear sight of it - made all the more difficult when she also has to do her utmost to not evacuate the contents of her stomach.

A.response_text: Ask for clarification on the ladder's location

E.response_text: Push the obnoxious bastard down the well

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!10.X0010!DESCRI.dialogue_text: She is about to ask for clarification when she feels a gentle push tilting her center of gravity beyond its tipping point and over the edge of the well.

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!10.X0011!DESCRI.dialogue_text: She pushes Dysmas towards the well, yet her hands simply slip off his shoulders and all of a sudden, he has her by the wrist. With a minimal downward jerk he causes her center of gravity beyond its tipping point and her legs dive over her head toward the stone aperture belching its unfathomably revolting gases. And in she goes.

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!10.002!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Eidos hears Dysmas' mockery echoing as she makes her unwilling descent and sees the cover gradually blotting out the light of the sun that poured in through the aperture of her demise. Perhaps it is unwise to associate with rotten apples.

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!20.000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: The citizens of Ur'Ruk bring a bound Eidos to a covered well. The lot of them pinch their noses before cracking open a space barely wide enough for a human to fit through. The reasons for both actions become quite evident first, as soon as Eidos' senses are assaulted by what can only be described as the insides of a Jinn's arse, belching forth from that hellish well; and second, as soon as she is tossed into the source of this stench for her misdeeds.\n\n\t\tThe portal closes, sealing off all light as Eidos careens down into the gut-wrenching stench of the unknown.

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.000!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "You see, for one who knows the structures of Vanquished ruins such as I, it is easy to see that this is a subterranean waterway that connects all buildings, large and small."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.X001!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Now, if you look at that spot down over there, you'll see the remains of a ladder descending into the tubes. Once do in there, we can access the lower levels of the tower."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!1.000!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Have a nice trip; see you next fall, malefactor mine!"

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.001!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "No plans to speak, foreigner? Just here to stare, are you?"

A.response_text: "Hello, I'm Eidos. A pleasure to make your acquaintance."

B.response_text: "My name is Eidos, but how did you know I was a foreigner?"

D.response_text: "And you are?"

E.response_text: "I'll give nothing; you must earn the right to hear my name."

F.response_text: "Stalphos Gremlinsbane, champion of Roostor."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.100!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "I'm Radan of Dazir, and the pleasure is all mine. What brings you to Ur'Ruk, young lady?"

A.response_text: "My decisions brought me here, good sir."

E.response_text: "My business is my own."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.200!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Well, it's clear you're not from around here, because people here don't speak to me, let alone get close to me."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.2000!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "My name is Radan of Dazir. What brings you to Ur'Ruk, young lady?"

A.response_text: "My decisions brought me here, good sir."

C.response_text: "This's where I happened to end up."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.X300!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Bah! Waste not my time, you jinnslave! Famlicus take you!"

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.400!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "I'm Radan of Dazir. Now tell me your name or we cannot have a civilized conversation."

D.response_text: "Civilized? Out here I doubt that would be possible."

E.response_text: "You haven't yet earned the right to hear my name."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.600!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "And I... am Radan... of Dazir. Well, what brings such a unique young lady to Ur'Ruk?"

F.response_text: "The gambling and the aging prostitutes?"

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.101!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Then you are one of the rare few who understands personal accountability? Perhaps I've found a kindred spirit..."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1010!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "I must confess, child, I know my days in this Falseflesh are numbered and soon my ghost will join my brothers and sisters who went before me to the Graylands."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1011!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "But I feel the need to tell my story and none here will listen."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1012!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "This is much to ask, but would you hear my story so that, when I die, I can live on in your memory?"

E.response_text: "You'll be forgotten; your death will be permanent."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.201!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "An admirable, though misguided, goal. You're an idealist, I suspect."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.2010!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "But let old Radan tell you something: truth is by its very nature opaque and inscrutable; not even Biracul himself is privy to its secrets."

A.response_text: "You may be right, but I will decide for myself."

B.response_text: "We're to surpass our predecessors, not to repeat their failures."

E.response_text: "I believe in my ability, not in your cynicism, old man."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.3010!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Well perhaps it too is by happenstance that this conversation is now over."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.X3011!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "May the Shining One guide you to a life of purpose."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.3012!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "So you're not completely divested of civility. Now then, Eidos, What brings you to Ur'Ruk?"

C.response_text: "This is where I happened to end up."

D.response_text: "Not the desire to talk to grumpy old men."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.X501!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Fine. Then go about your business and waste not my time, child."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.102!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Thank you. None wish to be forgotten - not even us sinners."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1020!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "I'll keep it as short as thoroughness permits."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.202!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Predecessors? If your motivations lay outside yourself, you'll always see the world tinted with 'expectations'. And expectation is the mother of disappoint..."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.2020!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "I'm old, child and I tire of this conversation."

E.response_text: "You know nothing of my motivations. What I do is for myself."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.103!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "I am Radan of Dazir, keeper of the flames of Biracul and Ark, may they eternally guide our way."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1030!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "I, opposer of the usurpers Khaa and Pakahron, supporter of the Archmage Kambesh, swear to you that what I'm about to reveal is truth, not absolute, rather truth with the clarity that only time and blindness can afford."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.104!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Branded Unseen and expelled from our birthplace, we braved the journey through the Salt Forest with the aid of our Tacribian allies. The scant few who survived crawled their way here to Ur’Ruk."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1040!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Here we sought to establish a microcosm of the Biraculian system used since times immemorial and to establish a civilized society as best we could."

D.response_text: "I see why no one wants to listen; I now count myself among their numbers."

E.response_text: "Your tale bores me; none will remember you."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.105!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "But none of this could've been accomplished without the aid of the man who'd turn out to be not only our greatest benefactor, but also our fiercest malefactor: Ormenos of Jer."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1050!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "When we arrived, he had already taken residence in the Red Tower..."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.106!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "It was a vile den - one that I alone saw the inside of and live to tell."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1060!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Ormenos had become obsessed with immortality and had been experimenting on draugnir prior to our arrival."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1061!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Though, only Biracul knows how he managed to secure so many 'fresh' ones to perform his questionable experiments on."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.107!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Now, I should mention that he took me on as an apprentice when he realized I had an inquisitive mind and a skillful hand."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1070!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "By then, he had helped establish order, given us a purpose, and a system for survival. So my presence wouldn't be missed for several hours a day while I helped in his workshop."

D.response_text: "I think I've heard enough of this tiresome tale."

E.response_text: "I won't miss your presence either; I'll listen no more."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.108!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Oh, the wonders he showed me! Myriad tomes transcribed by the ghostly quills he had floating and bobbing through use of some obscure Techne... And the thousandfold secrets each tome held between its leathery covers!"

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1080!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "What blissful days those were. But all festivals end."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.10800!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Two years elapsed, and soon Ormenos stopped appearing among us. I alone bore witness to his hideous transformation into a draug - physically, that is - for by some miracle he had maintained his own will."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1081!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "He was convinced that he had reached the limits of his experiments with draugnir and had grown dissatisfied with his specimens, seeking to explore options he had to that point ignored."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1082!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "He decided to continue his experiments using humans instead..."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.109!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "He took the first of his subjects in the deep of the night - a beautiful young girl named Arkana."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1090!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "We awoke to find her bed empty, no trace of a struggle - in fact it was neatly made, even. All wondered what could've happened to her, and set out to scour the ruins immediately. But by sunset all we knew was that she'd utterly vanished."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1091!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "The following afternoon, after completing my duties in the greenhouse, I went to Ormenos' workshop as usual."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.110!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "But it had a new addition: a porcelain-skinned cadaver with the face's skin carefully peeled open."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1100!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "The only thing I could tell for certain was that it wasn’t a draugnir - because of the rust-colored stains."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1101!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Arkana was the first, but not the last."

D.response_text: "I wish you'd have been you chosen instead..."

E.response_text: "This ends now, or you'll meet a fate worse than Arkana."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.111!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Then another tell-tale sign revealed itself when the new corpses began to rot. In the two years prior, I’d never seen a draugnir corpse rot."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1110!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "So, Ormenos asked me to dispose of them in the cess pit - the one over on there, on the other side of this very fountain. And I obliged. I did so because emotion blinded me to reason."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1111!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "This happened on several occasions and terror gripped my siblings in exile. They could only wonder who'd next be spirited away."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.112!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Then, at the peak of our anxiety, we turned on each other. Blaming one another for the disappearances. Casting doubt where none belonged."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1120!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "We stopped performing our duties as tensions grew. Started sleeping in smaller groups with people keeping watch in shifts. I even stopped going to Ormenos' tower."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1121!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "This waking nightmare continued until one day, two magi and a garrison of armor-clad Neverborn arrived."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1122!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "By then, we would've even welcomed Rubied Jinn himself through the gates if he would stop the madness."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1123!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Yet neither the magi nor the Neverborn seemed to notice our existence at all."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.113!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "We desperately tried to communicate with them, but they had no ears to hear us, no eyes to see us. We were invisible, unseen."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1130!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "I remember it quite clearly; they were both stately figures - one of them reminiscent of Biracul himself, even."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1131!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Whatever they were, though, they were clearly not human. Our transformation as Unseen was absolute; we were invisible to their Truesight."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.114!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "One other oddity was how they navigated the city as though it were their home."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1140!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "They headed straight for the tower, remaining inside for quite some time."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1141!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Upon exiting, one of the magi held in his hand a spherical, blue crystal. The other held a crystal greener than this fountain behind me. They sealed the door with some ancient Techne and we never heard from Ormenos again."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1142!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "No more Ormenos. No more disappearances. The connection was obvious in hindsight, but now even the truth-blind could see it. We assumed he was taken away and punished."

D.response_text: "I'm the one being punished; I tire of this tale."

E.response_text: "If you don't shut up, I'll send you to meet Ormenos."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.115!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "The fog of fear cleared and the healing process began."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1150!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Being the only person to have seen the inside of the tower, I shared what I'd seen with the others."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1151!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Infuriated, they blinded me, wishing to make me relive those sights in my darkness, to atone for the victims who could've been saved had I spoken up."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1152!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "I don't know why I never said anything... No, I think I know exactly why. I just couldn’t believe a man that in love with knowledge could be evil."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.116!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "But since that day, none here have had ears nor eyes for old Radan. I'm just an Unseen, even among Unseen."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1160!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "I just sit here near the cess pit, waiting for the day I've the courage to cast myself in as I did with so many of my friends."

KABU!UR'RUK!EMERALD FONT!0.1161!RADAN!.dialogue_text: "Well, this is my story. Please remember it, child."

A.response_text: "I'll remember you, Radan. Go in peace."

D.response_text: "I regret having wasted my time."

E.response_text: "You deserved it; and now being forgotten is your final punishment."

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!0.000!DES.dialogue_text: The burning sands, the arid air, the setting sun... Eidos stops for a moment and begins to stare directly at that radiant mass off in the distance, unable to pull her eyes away from it, trying to extract every drop of truth from it...

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!0.001!DES.dialogue_text: All to no avail. The external world makes almost as little sense to her as the mysteries of her origins, or even the uncertainties of her inner workings. She feels her mind at conflict. A battlefield for any number of bizarre and inexplicable whims and wills.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!0.002!DES.dialogue_text: She feels helpless - as well she should.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!0.003!DES.dialogue_text: A sudden urge to meditate wells up within her, then morphs into the urge to sleep, and then into the urge to advance. Cyclically. Eternally. Locked in a mutual gravitation of desire, pulling in different directions, tugging at her Trueflesh. Until Eidos or that which acts through her stops the cycle.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!0.X100!DE.dialogue_text: Eidos kneels down facing west and closes her eyes...

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!0.1002!DE.dialogue_text: It soon reverses and spins ever more intensely.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!0.1003!DE.dialogue_text: And in an instant, time flattens so that it is entirely visible from Eidos' vantage point, as if a sphere looked upon its flat reflection in a mirror. She sees it begin and end at the Red Tower beyond those ghostly walls before her, the endless spiral of existence, racing away from its origin by racing toward it.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!0.1004!DE.dialogue_text: She then turns her gaze inwards and in a flash...

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!0.X101!DE.dialogue_text: Eidos kneels down once more facing west and closes her eyes. But time neither slows nor stops. Any insight she had previously has been lost in the fog of memory.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!0.102!DES.dialogue_text: Eidos kneels down facing west and closes her eyes. But time neither slows nor stops for her. Yet a disconcerting feeling fills her. It pecks at her like a desert carrion feeder. It gnaws at her, mockingly. Her inability to regain the insight is illusory, for mastery of time is already within her grasp... However, she requires serious introspection to remember it and for now has no other option but to press forward.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!0.X103!DE.dialogue_text: Awakening from her meditation. Eidos' insight is sealed off. She must first acquire the skill the Graylands wolf spoke of, or forever be deprived of her insight.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!0.103!DES.dialogue_text: Awakening from her meditation. Eidos' insight remains open. She has the ability to peer inside her own timeless Trueflesh, but one thing is certain: it did not come from kneeling in a desert. Serious introspection is needed to regain the transcendence previously experienced.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!0.500!DES.dialogue_text: Overcome with fatigue, Eidos lies down in the sand, its searing heat no longer present. As she closes her eyes, time begins to slow... stop... then to reverse and spin ever more intensely, in all directions simultaneously.\n\n\t\tAnd in an instant, time flattens so that it is entirely visible from Eidos' vantage point, as if a sphere looked upon its flat reflection in a mirror. She sees it begin and end at the Red Tower, the endless spiral of existence, racing away from its origin by racing toward it.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!0.501!DES.dialogue_text: Eidos feels her ghost extricate itself from her Falseflesh, now in possession of a clarity of vision she never before possessed.\n\n\t\tShe sees the thinly veiled machinations of Khaa, Khlutt and Pakahron. The futile struggles of Logira and Quangjo. The intrigue of Mifas'cul, Famlicus, Famlaz. The intentions of Nargund, Vanargand, the Emerald Architect. The purpose of his three spawn. This and more, all concurrently.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!0.503!DES.dialogue_text: Widening her view, Eidos sees herself as Thetian, still wandering Jer. She sees her life as the Jinnwraith Rikharr. She sees herself as Torma, the prophet, locked in the Vault of the Enclave. And as Wulfias, slave turned master. But then finally as Viracocha, the plurality of the Biracul.\n\n\t\tAnd in so doing, time folds in on itself and the cycle repeats. Zeroing in on a single point, a flash of light consumes her thought...

D.response_text: SUR

E.response_text: TYR

F.response_text: LOO

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!1.000!DES.dialogue_text: Eidos is soon enveloped by the shadow of cyclopean walls. These walls stand in stark contrast to the broken buildings they protect, for they are in pristine condition. No gaps, nor joints divide the surface, giving the impression that the walls were pulled up from the very ground they now stand upon, pinched into position by some godly hand. The surface is enmeshed throughout by twisting bands of shimmering metal, the outlined scales of a gargantuan beast, girding an inner skin of stone.\n\n\t\tThe walls, however, are in alliance with a rather unlikely bedfellow. The sole opening in them is guarded by a makeshift gate that seals the entry portal to the city. The gate is as dissimilar to the walls as a Sentry is to a Warbeast. Like a buralp patch on a silk dress.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!1.001!DES.dialogue_text: At Eidos' call, the silhouette of a person appears briefly. It turns around and whistles toward some unseen compatriot below, only to then melt back into the shadows. But before long, the gate begins to crack open, allowing barely enough space for a single person to slip through.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!10.000!DE.dialogue_text: Eidos and her legions come upon the entrance to the city. While the city was barely visible from a distance, its cyclopean walls offer no hints of what might lie within. The high city walls themselves are in pristine condition, carved from forbidding granite stone and enmeshed throughout by twisting bands of shimmering metal. The interlocking stone plates are as scales of a gargantuan beast, girding an inner skin of steel.\n\n\t\tThe walls, however, stand in stark contrast to the makeshift gate sealing the entry portal to the city. This gate, though sturdy, is foreign to the structure and is of much more humble artifice.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!10.001!DE.dialogue_text: At Eidos' call, the silhouette of a person appears briefly. It then turns around and whistles toward some unseen compatriot below, only to disappear back into the shadows. The gate, however, remains still and unmoving. Before long, a whole contingent of hooded figures appear in file along the parapet. It seems Eidos' and her legions are unwelcome here.

E.response_text: Take the city by force

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!10.002!DE.dialogue_text:
Eidos directs her will towards the weakened gate; and envisioning her followers descent upon these folk, silently commands them to tear asunder the meager defenses.

		The dream becomes manifest as her mere thought drives the undead legions upon the city. They rush towards the gate and begin to scale it with a simian grace, heedless of the blows raining down upon them by weapons of stone and glass. The guards at the top are flung from their makeshift battlements to their definitive end. They become the envy of their fellows once Eidos' vanguard rips open gates, granting access to the rest of the slavering masses of draugnir and Neverborn.

		Eidos likewise enters, following in the wake of their destruction.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!20.000!DE.dialogue_text: Eidos and her legions have returned to the slaughter house that once was the city of Ur'Ruk. Whatever hopes and dreams might have been entertained by these folk are now less than memory, as their remains are peck apart by the swirling desert birds.\n\n\t\tThere is nothing beyond the desolation already wrought by the hand of Eidos. She turns her gaze to the Stilled Sand Crater and looks beyond it. The path she walks now can lead to but one place. Following in the footsteps of Rikharr she leads her army into the crater.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!30.000!DE.dialogue_text: Eidos returns once more to the city walls of Ur'Ruk. The imposing structure seems resolute and unchanging. Yet, a deeper perception reveals this to be an illusion. The sand has slowly begun to wear the granite away. Cracks and fissures, though minor, spread through every stone. Entropy leaves none unscathed.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!100.000!D.dialogue_text: Eidos walks back out into the Wasteland as the Gates of Awakening close behind her. Neither thought nor sound follows her and she is forgotten almost as soon as the door is sealed.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!100.001!D.dialogue_text: She calls out to the guards, but none stir atop the ramparts and the gates do not open at her call. Hazanna is true to her word and will not allow Eidos readmission into Ur'Ruk.

KABU!UR'RUK!GATES OF AWAKENING!120.000!D.dialogue_text: Eidos walks back out into the Wasteland. The now lifeless city of Ur'Ruk recedes into the background as she makes her way towards the Stilled Sand Crater.

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.000!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The stone cracks like eggshells as Eidos walks through the ruined streets of Ur'Ruk. Up ahead, she sees a building of curious make. Columns built up from loose bricks and stones have been carefully piled into low supports without the use of mortar. Between them, large panes of clear crystal have been dragged from the shattered structures and placed in between these mounds to form a crude, though functional greenhouse.

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.001!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Eidos walks into the confines of the structure and is nearly overwhelmed with beautiful sight and refreshing smell of the environs. In contrast to the dusty, lifeless cityscape, this place is as an oasis in the desert.\n\n\t\tThe trickling sound of flowing water and the defiant green of leafing plants leave doubt as to whether this be a phantasm of a treacherous mind. Yet, as the pungent stench of night soil assaults her nose, all questions vanish and the garden cements its place firmly in Eidos' reality.

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.002!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: There are a handful of people milling about, busying themselves with the task of raising crops. Some siphon silty water up from a well at its center. Others mix the water into troughs with dust and human waste. Still others tend to the shoots of green that rise from the black earth. Only a few seem to be available for an exchange of words.

A.response_text: Speak to one of the folk here

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.X101!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The elderly couple occupy their usual haunt on the bench, nestled among a row of ripening fruit trees. There they continue to quietly survey the greenery all about.\n\n\t\tNakara, however, is nowhere to be seen, and even the tracks left by her nervous pacing have been erased by the bare feet of the bustling Greenhouse laborers.

A.response_text: Talk to the dour old man

B.response_text: Talk to the elderly lady singing

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.X102!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Sitting on a bench that is nestled among a row of ripening fruit trees is an elderly couple, quietly surveying the greenery all about.\n\n\t\tNot far off is a woman pacing around the perimeter of the Greenhouse, her frantic rhythm and furrowed countenance belying feelings of fear and dread.

A.response_text: Talk to the dour old man

B.response_text: Talk to the elderly lady singing

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.103!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The exchange concluded, Eidos decides what to do next.

A.response_text: Speak to one of the folk here

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.200!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: While the panes are grubby and scratched, they are transparent enough for Eidos to get her bearings. Leaving out the southern exit will take her on the path back to either the Emerald Font or a residence area. The north door will take her on a course towards a looming Red Tower.

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!20.000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text:
As the laborers of the Greenhouse crowd around Eidos in a fear-crazed mob, she strikes out, fertilizing the soil with one of their blood.

		While their garden hoes, picks and spades make for crude weapons, their wielders are sufficient in number and ferocity to knock Eidos over and into the sulfurous earth. They proceed to bind her with lengths of twine that cuts painfully into her struggling skin.

		Having been restrained by the denizens of Ur'Ruk, Eidos is carried off to meet her fate...

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.200!EGIMESH!.dialogue_text: "What in Biracul's name are ya talkin' about? Yer sayin' yer either from the Wellsprin' or Ol' Tacriba?!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.101!EGIMESH!.dialogue_text: "'Cause I've seen it all, that's why, dummy!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.1010!EGIMESH!.dialogue_text: "When a youth, I'd friends in Dazir, Tambul and the Dawn Fortress!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.1011!EGIMESH!.dialogue_text: "Shortly before I took a bride, I completed my survey of the Jenowin Plain, and've worked on all the aqueducts in the region!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.1012!EGIMESH!.dialogue_text: "Was born in Dazir and worked as an artisan, spent several years trainin' as a ranger at the Dawn Fortress, until meetin' my lovely wife Kaleko that is, and then settled down as a farmer in Tambul!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.1013!EGIMESH!.dialogue_text: "Trust me, kid, I've done it all!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.X201!EGIMESH!.dialogue_text: "Oh! So YER the authority, then? Damned jinnlover! I hope ya meet the Vile One in the desert and get spirited away! Bah! Jinns take ya!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.501!EGIMESH!.dialogue_text: "Appearances can be deceivin', kid! Fer example, ya looked like a smart and respectable young lady. Bah! Jinns take ya from me! I've no time to waste on the likes of ya!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.1020!EGIMESH!.dialogue_text: "He and Khaa conspired against and assassinated Archmage Kambesh!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.1021!EGIMESH!.dialogue_text: "Kambesh had to take control of Tambul - temporarily, ya see - as Pakahron was only newly appointed as a librarian when his predecessor left the Falseflesh."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.103!EGIMESH!.dialogue_text: "Those of us who stood against Pakahron and Khaa - on account of their inexperience, ya see - were then cast away as dissidents and Unseen!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.1030!EGIMESH!.dialogue_text: "We 'ere forced to drink the coal-black blood of the draugnir! Our minds warped drastically - so much so that when those magi and their jinncursed Neverborn army came by decades ago, they didn't even seem to know we 'ere here!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.1040!EGIMESH!.dialogue_text: "Ay, I just shudder to think about the mess that Rikharrlovin' Pakahron has left in Tambul... or in all of Kabu for that matter."
