KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.3001!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "Though Hazanna has shown us the way, this fear is the scar I bear for my wrong-thought."

D.response_text: "...Perhaps you've been made a victim once more."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.400!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "Hazanna is imposing and severe, and I admit that I fear her, but she seeks to guide us to place of peace."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.4000!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "I really thought that Ormenos, uh... I mean... the Vile One! I thought he'd be our savior. But now I see that we can only count on each other and not on any outsiders."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.4001!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "Though Hazanna has shown us the way, this fear that plagues me is the scar I bear for my wrong-thought."

D.response_text: "...Perhaps you've been made a victim once more."

E.response_text: "At least you're highly skilled in the crafting of excuses."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.500!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "Sorry if I offended you; it was truly not my intent."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.5000!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "Our exile has been so painful for all of us and honestly, I still bear the scars of our hardships."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.5001!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "I really thought that Ormenos, uh... I mean... the Vile One! I thought he'd be our savior. But now I see that we can only count on each other and not on any outsiders."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.5002!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "Though Hazanna has shown me the way, this fear is the scar I bear for my wrong-thought."

A.response_text: "It sounds as though Hazanna is an overly harsh leader."

D.response_text: "...Perhaps you've been made a victim once more."

E.response_text: "At least you're highly skilled in the crafting of excuses."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.600!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "I see you've been wounded in your life as well... Our exile has been so painful for all of us and honestly, I still bear the scars of our hardships."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.6000!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "I really thought that Ormenos, uh... I mean... the Vile One! I thought he'd be our savior. But now I see that we can only count on each other and not on any outsiders."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.6001!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "Though Hazanna has shown us the way, this fear is the scar I bear for my jinnborn wrong-thought."

A.response_text: "It sounds as though Hazanna is an overly harsh leader."

E.response_text: "At least you're highly skilled in the crafting of excuses."

F.response_text: "I say, if life is pelting you with lemons, you better get a lemon-bat."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.101!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "I too have had similar deviations in spirit, sister. But, no! Hazanna has told me many times that I must guard against the weaknesses of the mind... and that..."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.1010!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "...that I must strengthen myself through good acts and not by the triviality of words and thoughts!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.1011!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "But why would you say such things against our leader? Do you feel our way of life is in error? Please, tell me what you believe, sister!"

A.response_text: "She rules by fear, not by kindness."

B.response_text: "I don't think repressing thought is a virtue."

D.response_text: "...Were I leader, I'd never rule in such a manner."

E.response_text: "Why bother? It's too late for all of you."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.201!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "His name is unclean and unspoken by our folk - mere utterance of it invites the Jinns into our weak minds! I spoke the Vile One's name in weakness!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.2010!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "If you succumb to the Jinn's embrace, you'll become as the pariah, Radan. Many of the others blame him and shun him from our fellowship and family."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.2011!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "But I have pity for him, because all of us have been changed by our hardships - even Hazanna has been changed!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.2012!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "I remember Radan from when we traversed the Wasteland; he was a kind and gentle young man then!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.X2013!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "I don't claim to have the sight of the Shining One, but I think, if he became evil, it was in the same way all of us traveled to Ur'Ruk in our exile: imperceptibly descending, one step at a time."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.X301!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "I hope Aizos will suffer with you, sister... and that the Shining One will preserve you."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.501!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps it's as you say. Perhaps there's no hope for any of us any more. We were all damned when..."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.X5010!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "No! I cannot be lead into the ruin of the Jinn's embrace!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.102!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "You're right sister! I, too, have long thought it so! We've grown so familiar with the face of cruelty, perhaps we no longer know how to live without it!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.1020!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "I've seen that very face upon Hazanna now. And the idea that we must surrender the worship of Biracul himself... well, I don't think I can bear it!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!0.X1021!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "But I shall bear it. Your words have given me courage. Thank you... my friend."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!1.X000!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "Hello again, sister. I hope you're healthy in body."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!2.X000!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "Thank you again, my friend. If I cannot be myself in the open, I shall be true to myself in secret."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!2.010!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "I fear for your safety, my friend!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!2.011!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "Gapa came to me recently and told me that you're spreading dissension among the Unseen against Hazanna."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!2.012!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "You must be careful! Because if she told me, she's surely telling others!"

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!2.X013!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "Remember, if we cannot be ourselves in the open, we must be content to be true to ourselves in secret, sister."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!2.X014!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "Take care, my friend. While I'll not speak against you, many will heed the words of Gapa."

KABU!UR'RUK!GREENHOUSE!9.X000!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "No, truly! I can't say any more."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!1.000!DESC.dialogue_text: The makeshift gate closing behind her, Eidos now finds herself in a space that dwarfs its entrance by comparison. A domed ceiling arcs overhead, its fading blue color giving the impression of a fabricated sky, complete with clouds and birds in flight. Dully shining crystalline sconces adorn the walls, and work hard to chase away the shadows.\n\n\t\tSome stubborn darkness yet remains, however, and countless statues now stare at her from their shadowy alcoves. Irreparably scarred from their war with time, all of the carvings are now faceless and most seem little more than amorphous stone pillars. A number of sharp edges hint at the angular and idealized forms they were born with, but whatever artistry or feeling they may have once been imbued with has long since been devoured by the city's ruin.

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!1.X001!DES.dialogue_text:
Nearly invisible at first, she soon detects the first signs of life, for standing along the edges of the hall, in imitation of the statues behind them, is a cadre of men. Their crudely cobbled cudgels impart the sense that they are guardians, though their bearing belies their inexperience. Likewise mirroring the stones they seek to mimic is the deathly pallor of their skin – a pallor with which she is now most personally acquainted.

		A granite table stands as the centerpiece of the hall - though it appears to be entirely ceremonial, as there are none sitting at it save a stately lady gazing down upon Eidos from on high. At her side, a lone attendant kneels.

		The leader beckons Eidos, firmly and matronly, without bothering to rise from her chair.

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!2.X000!DES.dialogue_text: Eidos is in the main hall of Ur'Ruk. At one end of the hall is a makeshift gate, at the other is an adjacent room with a curious green structure visible inside. To her left appears to be another exit toward the streets of the city.\n\n\t\tThe stately leader of the Ur'Rukians remains seated at her table, busy with work. None sit but her, though there is an attendant kneeling nearby.

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!2.X100!DES.dialogue_text: The hall no longer pleasing her, Eidos selects a new destination.

B.response_text: Go to the adjacent room with the green structure

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!2.500!DESC.dialogue_text: Before Eidos can react, the guards converge upon her from behind and cast a net, entangling her entirely. They act with utmost speed and stealth in the perfect unison of a well-oiled machine.\n\n\t\tThis is the inevitable fate of the nail that sticks out: it is hammered down to conform or removed entirely and replaced with one more suitable. Perhaps this is the only way to survive in the Wastes.

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!3.000!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos strides into the main hall of Ur'Ruk. The scene of people fleeing in terror from their pursuers is perversely euphoric. This twisted pleasure of the absolute power she commands is known only to her, a solitary pleasure though it may be - or is it because only 'one' can feel it that it has value?

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!3.X001!DES.dialogue_text: The people here are no match for an army of normal humans, much less one of the undying and Neverborn. They are made quick work of and the symphony of their screams makes for a poor prelude. If she is to hear more, she must find other victims. She must leave this place.

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!3.002!DESC.dialogue_text: The people here are no match for an army of normal humans, much less one of the undying and Neverborn. They are made quick work of and the symphony of their screams makes for a poor prelude. If she is to hear more, she must find other victims. She must leave this place.

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!3.003!DESC.dialogue_text: Yet, suddenly, Eidos feels a terrible magnetism pulling her towards the blood-red tower further inside the complex. All the Glyphs of the Graylands seem to fill her womb as though they were her unborn children. She sees the face of a clock spinning in reverse with images of Kabu racing into the past, condensing into a single point...

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!3.004!DESC.dialogue_text: And then, the utterly seductive pull dissolves, fading into nothing but a memory. Perhaps this place was significant to her in another life, but now all that is left now is death and a greater thirst for it.

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!20.000!DES.dialogue_text: Having been restrained by the denizens of Ur'Ruk, Eidos is carried off to meet her fate...

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.000!HAZA.dialogue_text: "You will hold your tongue and speak only when given permission, outsider."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.001!HAZA.dialogue_text: "Of all the peoples of Kabu, we alone aren't enslaved by either will or thought."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.002!HAZA.dialogue_text: "If you stay, you will assimilate. Or you will depart immediately and be one with Wasteland. Which do you choose?"

A.response_text: "I wish to know more about your people."

B.response_text: "I won't make a decision in haste."

C.response_text: "If you command me to leave I will, else, I'll stay."

D.response_text: "What benefit do I derive from staying?"

E.response_text: "I give orders; I don't take them."

F.response_text: "Should I stay or should I go now?"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.100!HAZA.dialogue_text: "You seek knowledge before action and think it wisdom."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.1001!HAZ.dialogue_text: "You will make an answer from the Form and thus, it will be true. Whatever you say next will be your judgment."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.1002!HAZ.dialogue_text: "Will you be counted as a sister among us?"

A.response_text: "If your ways require it, I shall."

B.response_text: "Such a commitment shouldn't be made in ignorance."

E.response_text: "Sister? I want no part in such delusions."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.200!HAZA.dialogue_text: "You seek knowledge before action and think it wisdom."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.2001!HAZ.dialogue_text: "You will make an answer from the Form and thus, it will be true. Whatever you say next will be your judgment."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.2002!HAZ.dialogue_text: "Will you be counted as a sister among us?"

A.response_text: "If your ways require it, I shall."

B.response_text: "Such a commitment shouldn't be made in ignorance."

C.response_text: "There's no reason for me to refuse."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.300!HAZA.dialogue_text: "You are without an apparent will it seems. Perhaps it's because you are one who wishes no harm..."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.3000!HAZ.dialogue_text: "Or perhaps it's because your mind is a Famlazian nest of betrayal and lies..."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.3001!HAZ.dialogue_text: "Aizos! Hazanna, your servant, is whole and unified with the Form! So too must the one before me become if she wishes to remain! As it pleases you, our Mother, the Mother of all Form!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.3002!HAZ.dialogue_text: "Now answer. Will you be counted as a sister among us?"

B.response_text: "Such a commitment shouldn't be made in ignorance."

D.response_text: "Hold on, now. Can't we discuss this like civilized folk?"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.400!HAZA.dialogue_text: "None, because there is no place here for one who asks such questions."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.4000!HAZ.dialogue_text: "It's not food for the Form of which you speak, but souls for the wraiths that haunt your mind. And the dead have no place here, nor will they find any sustenance!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.X4001!HA.dialogue_text: "Guards, show this woman where the path of the Vile One leads!"

D.response_text: "Hold on, now. Can't we discuss this like civilized folk?"

E.response_text: "You won't be alive long enough to show me anything!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.4002!HAZ.dialogue_text: "Guards, show this woman where the path of the Vile One leads!"

D.response_text: "The Form is fed not with the fire of the mind but its smoke!"

E.response_text: "You won't be alive long enough to show me anything!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.500!HAZA.dialogue_text: "So, one of the Tormentors has wandered into our midst."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.5000!HAZ.dialogue_text: "Brothers and sisters! Did I not tell you it would be so? Even the Wasteland cannot strip some of their illusions!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.5001!HAZ.dialogue_text: "As for you, I think a just fate would be for you to be among those of like-temperament..."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.X5002!HA.dialogue_text: "Guards, show her where the rubbish belongs."

E.response_text: "You won't be alive long enough to show me anything!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.5003!HAZ.dialogue_text: "Guards, show her where the rubbish belongs."

D.response_text: "The Form is fed not with the fire of the mind but its smoke!"

E.response_text: "You won't be alive long enough to show me anything!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.600!HAZA.dialogue_text: "You may stay if you don't cause trouble."

F.response_text: "If I go, it might be double..."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.1010!HAZ.dialogue_text: "Know that you have not merely saved your own life, but many. We only harbor those who would work for the survival and care of all lives, not merely their own. Ours is a higher calling, a mission to feed the Form that lives in all of us!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.1011!HAZ.dialogue_text: "Your contribution to the well-being of your brothers and sisters begins now! Report to the Greenhouse, with haste."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.1012!HAZ.dialogue_text: "However, I warn you that your acceptance is a serious oath."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.1013!HAZ.dialogue_text: "We do not tolerate apostates who would rather dwell in the House of Dust than to make a table for the children of Aizos. Thus, if you ever exit Ur'Ruk and abandon your family, do not expect a welcomed return!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.X1014!HA.dialogue_text: "Now go, and give aid to the helpless, food to the starving and care to the suffering, in Aizos' name!"

D.response_text: "But of course, wise Hazanna."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.201!HAZA.dialogue_text: "We had an 'inquisitive mind' lord over us at one point... and it almost caused our demise."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.2010!HAZ.dialogue_text: "The Vile One, was the second coming of Rikharr and he was stopped by what only could have been the divine intervention of Aizos herself."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.2011!HAZ.dialogue_text: "I will not allow your budding young inquisitiveness to blossom."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.2012!HAZ.dialogue_text: "Guards, let's show her where the Vile One dumped the bodies of our friends and relatives in our wretched past!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.401!HAZA.dialogue_text: "...So, you know the way of Aizos, I see..."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.4010!HAZ.dialogue_text: "All of us here seek to uncover her within us! And I now see that you spoke merely to see if you could do the same among our people. Fear not, sister; you are among family now!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.601!HAZA.dialogue_text: "Yes, the Wastes are unforgiving. At least here we have a modicum of civilization! Now are you staying or not?!"

F.response_text: "As long as you promise you're gremlin-free!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.602!HAZA.dialogue_text: "What?! Of course there are no gremlins here!"

F.response_text: "Then, by Roostor's mighty comb, I'll stay!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.603!HAZA.dialogue_text: "You are clearly as innocuous as you are odd. However, I don't think I can trust you with any real responsibility, so I'll just say this: don't cause trouble and don't choke on your own tongue."

F.response_text: "You can count on me, Stalphos Gremlinsbane, to do the job!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.X6030!HA.dialogue_text: "And I warn you that if you exit Ur'Ruk and abandon your family, do not expect a welcomed return! Now out of my sight!"

F.response_text: "No worries, if I leave I can just restart and come back in a different life."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!1.X100!HAZ.dialogue_text: "You're still here?! Get to the Greenhouse immediately!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!1.X600!HAZ.dialogue_text: "You're still here?! Why don't you go play with Birarkul and Arkash - I fear you don't have the intellectual capacity for much beyond that."

F.response_text: "Unlike you, I, Stalphos Gremlinsbane, fear nothing!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!1.900!HAZA.dialogue_text: "I warn you now, outlander. You are trying my patience."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!1.X901!HAZ.dialogue_text: "Go now or you will be removed by force!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!1.999!HAZA.dialogue_text: "That's it! Guards, show her where the rubbish belongs!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!2.000!HAZA.dialogue_text: "I have heard it said that you are not entirely comfortable here."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!2.001!HAZA.dialogue_text: "Well, you see, we have a tried and true solution for that."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!2.002!HAZA.dialogue_text: "Guards, show her where the outsiders belong."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.X000!KAH.dialogue_text: "As you walked the Wasteland, I am sure you felt it taking things from you - it certainly did to us, and I speak not simply our fallen family, lost to the dust and sand..."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.001!KAHI.dialogue_text: "No, entering the Waste took away what were once our homes and families. It left us without leadership. It destroyed our past and future. Even the voice of Biracul was silenced within us!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.002!KAHI.dialogue_text: "Finally, we arrived here, where the Vile One stripped us of our dignity and pride. And yet, it was all for our good."

A.response_text: "How could it be good to lose your home and kin?"

B.response_text: "But can the past ever be removed?"

D.response_text: "I agree. You've become strong in your poverty."

E.response_text: "It seems you were also stripped of your minds."

F.response_text: "So... are you guys some kind of nudist colony?"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.010!KAHI.dialogue_text: "I've heard it said you're discontent with the will of our guide and elder sister, Hazanna."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.X011!KAH.dialogue_text: "If it is so, then my loyal heart has no ears for your jinnspeech!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.100!KAHI.dialogue_text: "Because they were never really ours to begin with!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.1000!KAH.dialogue_text: "Biracul once said, 'The Falseflesh is weak, and subject to change and decay; but the Trueflesh can never be destroyed.'"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.1001!KAH.dialogue_text: "He spoke with a ruby tongue, spitting his jinncursed lies."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.1002!KAH.dialogue_text: "The Graylands? The Eye? Mere phantoms to scare us into confusion and doubt. The magi of Kabu removed our connection to the link and blinded themselves to our minds. The Trueflesh is lost to us, yet still we live on as we always will!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.1003!KAH.dialogue_text: "Do you not see? We have lost nothing, sister..."

A.response_text: "But surely, there must be some truth to your past lives."

B.response_text: "So what is the truth behind the illusion?"

E.response_text: "You're blind to think weakness a virtue."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.200!KAHI.dialogue_text: "There is no past. A mere trick of the mind is all it is!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.2000!KAH.dialogue_text: "Memories are scars of the mind, but we bear them in the now. We are each of us an indivisible aspect of Aizos in the rushing flow of life, sister."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.2001!KAH.dialogue_text: "It may take us our whole lives to strip the illusions from our brains, but it will be worth it when our bodies return to dust."

A.response_text: "But surely, there must be some truth to your past."

B.response_text: "So what is the truth behind the illusion?"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.3001!KAH.dialogue_text: "Appearances are as they are, sister. It is your thoughts that distort the truth!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.3002!KAH.dialogue_text: "The mind is a spider, weaving its webs of illusion across what the Form knows to be true."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.3003!KAH.dialogue_text: "We live and breathe, despite the attempts of the world to subdue and destroy us!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.3004!KAH.dialogue_text: "The magi of Kabu removed our connection to the link and blinded their Truesight to our minds. Yet still, we live on as we always will!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.3005!KAH.dialogue_text: "Do you not see? We've lost nothing, sister..."

B.response_text: "So what is the truth behind the illusion?"

D.response_text: "...But what more illusions remain?"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.400!KAHI.dialogue_text: "You are wrong: we have always been strong! We have simply cast aside the thoughts that debased us!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.4000!KAH.dialogue_text: "Biracul once said, 'The Falseflesh is weak, and subject to change and decay; but the true can never be destroyed.'"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.4001!KAH.dialogue_text: "He spoke with a ruby tongue, spitting his jinncursed lies."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.4002!KAH.dialogue_text: "The Graylands? The Eye? Mere phantoms to scare us into confusion and doubt!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.4003!KAH.dialogue_text: "The magi of Kabu removed our connection to the link and thus blinded their Truesight to our minds. The Trueflesh is lost to us, yet still we live on, as we always will!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.4004!KAH.dialogue_text: "Do you not see? We have lost nothing, sister..."

D.response_text: "...But what more illusions remain?"

E.response_text: "You're blind to think weakness a virtue."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.500!KAHI.dialogue_text: "Indeed, we have lost our deceptive minds; it is thoughts that distort the truth!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.5000!KAH.dialogue_text: "The mind is a spider, weaving its webs of illusion across what the Form knows to be true."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.5001!KAH.dialogue_text: "We live and breathe, despite the attempts of the world to subdue and destroy us! That is true beyond doubt!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.5002!KAH.dialogue_text: "The magi of Kabu removed our connection to the link and blinded their truesight to our minds. Yet still, we live on as ever we have."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.5003!KAH.dialogue_text: "Do you not see? We have lost nothing sister..."

A.response_text: "But surely, there must be some truth to your past lives."

D.response_text: "...But what more illusions remain?"

E.response_text: "You're blind to think weakness a virtue."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.600!KAHI.dialogue_text: "If by naked you mean we stand disrobed of lies, you're correct!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.6000!KAH.dialogue_text: "Biracul once said, 'The Trueflesh can never be destroyed.'"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.6001!KAH.dialogue_text: "But he spoke with a ruby tongue! Words spat only to scare us into submission!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.6002!KAH.dialogue_text: "The magi of Kabu removed our connection to the link and blinded their Truesight to our minds. Yet still, we live on as we always will."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.6003!KAH.dialogue_text: "Do you not see? We have lost nothing, sister..."

A.response_text: "But surely, there must be some truth to your past lives."

E.response_text: "You are blind to think weakness a virtue."

F.response_text: "I think seeing me naked would be more than y'all can handle."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.101!KAHI.dialogue_text: "You think you speak with your own voice, but you don't! The Form is hidden from you!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.1010!KAH.dialogue_text: "No, instead you speak the dead words of dead souls that came before."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.1011!KAH.dialogue_text: "The past doesn't exist, and those it haunts will only do us harm."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.1012!KAH.dialogue_text: "I'll hear no more of your lies! We're pure and you're corrupted!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.1013!KAH.dialogue_text: "Perhaps the Form will become known to you... or perhaps you'll be purified by death."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.X1014!KA.dialogue_text: "Regardless, all is as it should be!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.201!KAHI.dialogue_text: "The Form. The indivisible Form that will not change, despite all the injuries and pains that've been done to it."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.2011!KAH.dialogue_text: "She lives in totality through that which we share. But we bear the aches and pains for her as she bears death for us!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.X2012!KA.dialogue_text: "Rejoice, sister! All is as it should be."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.301!KAHI.dialogue_text: "You speak of maybes and uncertainties, but what is certain is that your mind is clouded with doubt and the threads of a thousand thoughts!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.3010!KAH.dialogue_text: "You think you walk a middle path, but there's no such road!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.3011!KAH.dialogue_text: "To be confused is to be beguiled. To be hesitant is to be dangerous. To be thoughtful is to be lost."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.3012!KAH.dialogue_text: "My loyal spirit has no ears for your ruby-tongued lies."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.X3014!KA.dialogue_text: "And all is as it should be!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.401!KAHI.dialogue_text: "Many, sister, too many! Many are those who've been twisted by the Mind that would do us harm..."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.4010!KAH.dialogue_text: "The Kabans that sent us will be repaid for their gift of exile; we shall salve our pain with their blood in time!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.4011!KAH.dialogue_text: "Though we must not forget that ever does the Mind seek to deceive the Form... We must be watchful, even here in Ur'Ruk..."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.X4012!KA.dialogue_text: "But put your faith in Aizos and her acolyte, Hazanna! Follow the Form that exists within. Do not impose your thoughts or will upon it and all will be as it should be!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.501!KAHI.dialogue_text: "You think you speak with your own voice, but you do not!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.5010!KAH.dialogue_text: "No, the Form is hidden from you! And instead you speak only the dead words of dead souls that came before!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.5011!KAH.dialogue_text: "Strength doesn't exist, and those that seek to change the Form will only do us harm!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.5012!KAH.dialogue_text: "My faithful spirit has no ears for your ruby-tongued lies! For we are pure and you are corrupted!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.5013!KAH.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you will be purified by death and only then know the Form!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.X5014!KA.dialogue_text: "Regardless, all is as it should be!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.601!KAHI.dialogue_text: "The uniqueness of your words, the strangeness of your phrases... it can mean only one thing..."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.6011!KAH.dialogue_text: "The indivisible Form that will not change, despite all the aches and pains that've been done to it, the gift of Aizos!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.6012!KAH.dialogue_text: "We bear the fruits of suffering for her as she bears eternal death for us."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!0.X6013!KA.dialogue_text: "Rejoice, sister! For all is as it should be!"

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!1.X000!KAH.dialogue_text: "Rejoice, sister! For all is as it should be."

KABU!UR'RUK!HALL OF VANARGAND!2.000!KAHI.dialogue_text: "My loyal spirit has no ears for jinnwhispered lies; for I hear only Aizos!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!1.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos steps into the dusty streets of Ur'Ruk. Many of the large, monolithic paving slabs have been shattered by some long-forgotten cataclysm, the road they form stretching out indefinitely before her. Myriad broken buildings lining the road hint at a bustling and crowded city - or rather the memory thereof. Now the city is populated by only a scant few souls, some of whom seem to haunt a residential area up ahead.

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!1.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The buildings along the streets are motley piles of stone rubble, gleaming with countless shards of sundered glass and fractured crystal. Not a liveable building among them. But one structure, a mighty, blood-red spire far off in the distance, miraculously remains unaffected by the waste and ruin plaguing Ur'Ruk. Though the dusty haze of the city corrupts her view, the untouched crimson tower stands resolute and whole, like a watchful guard over a forlorn graveyard.

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!1.X002!DESCR.dialogue_text:
Not too far along the path, Eidos spies an area where much of the rubble has been cleared away to give rise to ramshackle living structures, cobbled together from gnarled pipes and weathered cloth.

		Eidos enters and scans the area. Only the exceedingly old and the uselessly young seem to be present at the moment. Of greater note, though, is that no walls exist to neatly divide the living spaces. Indeed, the Ur'Rukians seem to have a communal living arrangement in the extreme and likely lack an understanding of the concept of personal space and privacy...

		A suspicion that is confirmed when two boys with vibrant green hair start tugging at Eidos' garments inquisitively.

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!1.X500!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos dashes with all her might to the end of the square, blasting past the two boys and leaving them to choke on her trail of desert dust.

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!2.X000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos stands in the Living Quarters of Ur'Ruk, among the citizenry who are too old or too young to work.

A.response_text: Go back to the Hall of Vanargand

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!2.100!DESCRI.dialogue_text: From here, Eidos sees that she could walk back to the Hall of Vanargand, where she entered the lost city. While the Red Tower in the distance looks to be inaccessible from here, she does see a path through a rubble field terminating in a glassy structure - a greenhouse of sorts.

A.response_text: Go back to the Hall of Vanargand

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!2.X150!DESCR.dialogue_text: The green-haired boys she saw before are nowhere to be seen. However, of the people nearby, there are three who seem amenable to having a conversation: one is a younger lady who looks to be feigning activity while wandering idly; another is a kind-faced elderly woman; and the third is a decrepit-looking merchant of some sort, peddling strange objects at an unattended stand.

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!2.150!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Of the people nearby, there are two who seem amenable to having a conversation: one is a younger lady who feigns activity while wandering idly; the other is a kind-faced elderly woman. The gruff peddler, Whabyn, seems to have closed his stand and now not even a hint of his existence remains, as though it had been sacrificed to the past.

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!2.X001!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos walks towards the perfectly-square carpet stall with its humble wares. The merchant who tends it looks to be even older than the ancient city he inhabits.

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!2.002!DESCRI.dialogue_text: With a gnarled hand, he draws back a piece of sack cloth to unveil a number of items, two of which seem to call out to Eidos: a statuette and a small leather-bound tome.

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!2.X100!DESCR.dialogue_text: The man hands the statue to Eidos for her to take a look.\n\n\t\tThe effigy is carved of polished black granite. While it is clear that at one time this item was once an object of great beauty, age has worn away many of its finer details. Nonetheless, its most significant details yet shine through: it is a voluptuous female figure of distended belly, bearing six faces and her body is covered in its entirety with circles.

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!2.X201!DESCR.dialogue_text: The man hands the tome to Eidos for her to examine.\n\n\t\tThe leather is cracked and worn, but it seems to be some kind of travel journal. The tome has folds and straps to protect and cover the yellowing pages, yet it is small enough to carry with relative ease. Upon opening it, Eidos sees pages written in a familiar, yet indecipherable, gibberish. An attempts to coax its secrets from the unknown script would be as productive as a debate with a draugnir.

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!2.X202!DESCR.dialogue_text: The man hands the tome to Eidos for her to examine.\n\n\t\tThe leather is cracked and worn but it seems to be some kind of travel journal. It has folds and straps to protect and cover the pages, yet it is small enough to carry with relative ease. Upon opening the tome, Eidos sees it is written by a traveler named Tourma.

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!2.X101!DESCR.dialogue_text: The wizened old man snatches his property back from Eidos' hand and glowers at her before packing up and storming off to parts unknown. He seems rather uninterested in conducting further business with Eidos, though the elderly lady and her idly youthful counterpart appear to be up for a chat.

A.response_text: Go to the Hall of Vanargand

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!20.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Having been restrained by the denizens of Ur'Ruk, Eidos is carried off to meet her fate...

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.X000!MAGDA.dialogue_text: "Greetin's, sister. Would ya like me to read yer scars?"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.000!MAGDA!.dialogue_text: "There's perhaps much of yer future I can foretell by lookin' at the wounds of the past."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.100!MAGDA!.dialogue_text: "That's strange... It seems ya lack any kind of mark whatsoever."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.1000!MAGDA.dialogue_text: "I'd heard of beauty, but flesh as untouched as yers is an oddity indeed!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.1001!MAGDA.dialogue_text: "It seems almost as though ya were newly bern."

D.response_text: "...I'm glad I didn't pay for this."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.200!MAGDA!.dialogue_text: "We Unseen don't have our deeds borne upon the Wheel of Thought, like most do - not e'en the Jinns know of our passin' anymer!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.2000!MAGDA.dialogue_text: "The only way we're known is by the Falseflesh, carryin' our past with us in mem'ry; our body and our scars are the proof we existed."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.2001!MAGDA.dialogue_text: "And without acknowledgment fer our lives, there'll be no record of who we are."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.400!MAGDA!.dialogue_text: "Not a drop of blood ner a bead of sweat, child! Nothin'!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.4000!MAGDA.dialogue_text: "'Cause we Unseen don't have our deeds borne upon the Wheel of Thought, like most do - not e'en the Jinns know of our passin' anymer!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.4001!MAGDA.dialogue_text: "We carry our past with us in mem'ry and scars. And without acknowledgment fer our lives, there'll be no record of who we are. So, I offer my prophecy free of any charge."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.X500!MAGDA.dialogue_text: "As ya please; I bear no ill-will. Aizos guide ya."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.101!MAGDA!.dialogue_text: "Well, not disturbin'. Perhaps I find it... hopeful. It may e'en be that yer touched by the Goddess herself - flesh crafted in her image and all."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.X101!MAGDA.dialogue_text: "But e'en the greatest of her gifts wither in time. Ne'er ferget that. The flesh is all we have and e'en it's but the breath of the mother."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.201!MAGDA!.dialogue_text: "Let me think on it... I s'pose that a blank hand could mean. That ya have no future..."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.2010!MAGDA.dialogue_text: "But that's impossible. Surely it must mean that yers is the life of return. That yer end is yer beginnin' is yer end and so on."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.X2010!MAGD.dialogue_text: "But in ya, the spiral is twisted into a circle. So ya have no future, because ya'll ne'er find yer end."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.301!MAGDA!.dialogue_text: "But that's impossible! Surely, it must mean that yers is the life of return. That yer end is yer beginnin' is yer end and so on."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.401!MAGDA!.dialogue_text: "Ah, now I see. Yer lackin' in scars because yer closed. Ya'll not open yerself to change."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.4010!MAGDA.dialogue_text: "Hate to say it, but yer much like the Vile One, unchangeable, seekin' to wrap yerself in the cloth of the mind..."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.4011!MAGDA.dialogue_text: "I re'mber hearin' from that ol' traitor, Radan, that the Vile One'd say the mind is its own place, that it could be unchanged by time or space..."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.X4011!MAGD.dialogue_text: "Perhaps ya walk the same accursed path as he, though I hope ya come to the path of Aizos, child."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.601!MAGDA!.dialogue_text: "Ha! I'd never hate ya, child. Perhaps I find it... hopeful. It may e'en be that yer touched by the Goddess herself - flesh crafted in her image and all."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.X601!MAGDA.dialogue_text: "But e'en the greatest of her gifts wither in time. Ne'er ferget that. The flesh is all we have and e'en it's but the breath of the mother."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!1.000!MAGDA!.dialogue_text: "Hello again, child of Aizos! Come to me if ya ever recei'e any wounds and I'd be happy to tell ya what they may portend!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.X000!WHABY.dialogue_text: "Tha's a book o' Torma's, 'tis true 'tis. He travl'd all 'round the world, he did. An' Ur'Ruk here was his las' stop! He ne'er return'ed frem the final home o' the Vanq'ished!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.0000!WHABY.dialogue_text: "Don'tcha be thinkin' ya have the like in whate'er parts ya be comin' frem, ne?"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.100!WHABYN.dialogue_text: "I took this book frem the Red Tower!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.1000!WHABY.dialogue_text: "Yes, I was one o' the ones tha' wen' in there with Orm'os, the Vile One. And I barely escap'ed with ma skin, I did."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.1001!WHABY.dialogue_text: "There're thin's in there I'd trade all ma wares to be fergettin'. He made me drink frem the damn pool, he did. Said I'd see thin's, he did."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.1002!WHABY.dialogue_text: "Bu' all tha' came frem the place is blud. Why ya think she's call'd the Red Tower fer?!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.1003!WHABY.dialogue_text: "I took this book frem his library. Orm'os was plenty book-learn'ed, he was. Had him a whole mess o' tomes and such. Wanted to know all he could abou' Glyphwork, he did."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.1004!WHABY.dialogue_text: "Torma was no mage, no ma'am, but he knew places. Places no one had e'er seen. Talks abou' 'em in the book there. Tells o' his search fer the first Though' Wheel."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.1005!WHABY.dialogue_text: "Wull, I nick'ed the book, and the fool saw nuthin', ol' Famlaz take the basterd!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.200!WHABYN.dialogue_text: "Torma walk'ed far. Oh, yes he did! Look'ed all 'round here fer the firs' Though' Wheel. Said tha' was the door to sum grea' old Whi' Palace, he did!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.2000!WHABY.dialogue_text: "I took this book frem the Vile One's library. Orm'os was plenty book-learn'ed, he was. Had him a whole mess o' tomes and such. Wanted to know all he could abou' Glyphwork, he did."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.2001!WHABY.dialogue_text: "Torma was no mage, no ma'am, but he knew places. Places no one had e'er seen. Talks abou' 'em in the book there. Tells o' his search fer the firs' Though' Wheel."

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.300!WHABYN.dialogue_text: "Tha' all ya have to say? D'ya know nuthin' o' Torma the Wayfarer? The man walk'ed 'round the whole world, he did! E'en walk'ed as far as Thiuda! And he walk'ed to Jer, too, oh, yes he did! Found himself in a whole mess o' trouble, too!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.3000!WHABY.dialogue_text: "Tha' book be his las' word in all Kabu! An only ol' Whabyn has the jinnlovin' thin', he does!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.3001!WHABY.dialogue_text: "I reckon there be plenny o' book-fools tha'd pay a pretty price to rub their grubby paws on this here, lemme tell ya!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.400!WHABYN.dialogue_text: "Old, 'tis true, 'tis true! Torma lived hundreds o' years in the pas', he did!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.4000!WHABY.dialogue_text: "Bu', Torma walk'ed far. Oh, yes he did! Look'ed all 'round here fer the firs' Though' Wheel. Said tha' was the door to sum grea' old Whi' Palace, he did!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.4001!WHABY.dialogue_text: "Tha' fool was lookin' fer so much whi' tha' he e'en walk'ed thru the Sal' Fores', the fool!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.4002!WHABY.dialogue_text: "Returned from there and stay'ed here a while - began thinkin' the Wheel turned to black or somethin'. Walk'ed underground lookin' and ne'ver come back abo'e ground, no ma'am!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.4003!WHABY.dialogue_text: "Tha' book be his las' word in all Kabu! An only ol' Whabyn has the jinnlovin' thin', he does!"

KABU!UR'RUK!LIVING QUARTERS!0.4004!WHABY.dialogue_text: "I reckon there be plenny o' book-fools tha'd pay a pretty price to rub their grubby paws on this here, lemme tell ya!"

KABU!UR'RUK!PORTAL OF WISDOM!0.X000!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos comes to the foot of the cloud-scraping edifice, a veritable geyser of blood scabbed into solidity. From this vantage point, she notes that the domed location of the living quarters seems to have been fashioned just outside of the range of this structure's sweeping shadow.

KABU!UR'RUK!PORTAL OF WISDOM!0.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: Running her fingers across the grainy surface of the megalith, Eidos detects neither seams nor joints, and sees neither supports nor windows. A single inconsistency exists in the sea of bloody homogeneity, a circular slab of reflective obsidian, and the brilliant white Glyph engraved upon its surface.

B.response_text: Go back to the Stone Circle

KABU!UR'RUK!PORTAL OF WISDOM!0.100!DESCR.dialogue_text: Placing her hand upon the Glyph, the myriad memories of lives lived and lost, sacrificed and wasted come flooding back, as if the past and future now tried to condense itself into the singular point of this very moment. All this senseless wandering, all this fruitless experimentation now leads to this inevitable beginning.

KABU!UR'RUK!PORTAL OF WISDOM!0.X101!DESC.dialogue_text: The sky flashes black and the ruined remains of the Ur'Rukian city begin to fall upwards, crumbling, disintegrating, returning to the nothing whence they came. Eidos is alone with the Red Tower in this abyssal darkness.

KABU!UR'RUK!PORTAL OF WISDOM!0.1010!DESC.dialogue_text: The sky flashes black and the ruined remains of the Ur'Rukian city begin to fall upwards, crumbling, disintegrating, returning to the nothing whence they came. Dysmas lets out a scream silenced by the upward pull's annihilating grip on all things but Eidos and her tower.

KABU!UR'RUK!PORTAL OF WISDOM!0.1011!DESC.dialogue_text: By the end of it all, she is alone with only the Red Tower as her companion in this abyssal darkness.

KABU!UR'RUK!PORTAL OF WISDOM!0.102!DESCR.dialogue_text: Frightened, she jerks her hand towards herself and tries to understand her current situation. The gate rumbles, distracting her attention from the innate fear filling her. The portal begins to recede into the darkness of the building's interior, as though fading from existence. Subsequently, lights begin to illuminate the corridor leading inwards...

KABU!UR'RUK!PORTAL OF WISDOM!0.200!DESCR.dialogue_text: Placing her hand upon the cold, black stone she feels the contours of the Glyph. It is incomplete, unfinished. The portal, like a giant's eye, simply peers at her expectantly. All of a sudden, Eidos sees herself through the portal's vision, staring blankly at the desolate cityscape behind the Falseflesh of a woman caressing a living building.

KABU!UR'RUK!PORTAL OF WISDOM!0.201!DESCR.dialogue_text: The moment freezes, and Time's ceaseless march knows its final destination. Eidos' final destination.

KABU!UR'RUK!PORTAL OF WISDOM!0.X202!DESC.dialogue_text: The burden is too heavy. She jerks her hand free from the building and falls to her knees, fingers now clawing at her temples, trying to remove a memory she cannot seem to recall. But as soon as the transient epiphany vanishes completely, she is able to recompose herself. Eidos stands up, dusting her knees off, and begins to make her way towards the Stone Circle.

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.001!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Looking left, Eidos sees the nearby tower rising skyward like a blood-covered bone mercilessly ripping through the city's skin. To her right, the squalid remains of a forgotten city lay out before her, lifeless and gray. Within the monochromatic sea of decay, the sun tries to set the city ablaze with a spark off the glassy Greenhouse just beyond the tower's ominous shadow. But the indifferent buildings refuse to ignite; the spark dies out. Before long, Eidos finds herself gently swaying back and forth, watching the reflection of the Greenhouse's glass walls below send sparks in all directions, almost as though she herself wished to see everything burn again...

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0020!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Spirals scar the stones' surfaces, etched deeply, flawlessly - inhumanly so. Eidos does not recognize their design, though they pull at her gaze with a dizzying and impossible geometry. Simultaneously snaking their way into the heart of the stone and down into the earth, Eidos feels as though she is witnessing the same spiral from multiple angles in synchronous. All achieve a similar effect individually; yet in unison, they ascend to the divine and inconceivable.

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Eidos walks the crumbling streets beneath a ominous gray, albeit cloudless, sky. Dust permeates the air, blurring the face of the sun. Relying on her memory as a compass, she believes she heads northeast, towards the Red Tower. Shattered structures heaped along the path are like the discarded husks of a harvest whose fruits expired long ago. Fruits that have rotted in the tainted soil, sowing the seeds for corrupted and degenerate crops.

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.001!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Before long, the path ends at a hill of barren earth upon which no building lies. Instead, only the sun-bleached trunks of long dead trees claw through the ground like some skeletal giant yet grasping at life even from its deathly slumber. Eidos ascends the hillock, the summit giving glimpses to a curious sight...

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.002!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Within a slight depression at the hill's top, Eidos stares down into a circle of carefully placed stones. Unlike much of the stony rubble strewn throughout the city, these appear to be natural, or at the very least, hewn so long ago that any touch of artifice has been erased.\n\n\t\tEach nearly the height of three people combined and some ten paces across, they are arranged in what looks to be concentric circles with the bone-white husk of a dead tree at its center. Eidos also sees that she is not alone here: a lone woman is nearby, wandering about lost in thought.

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!2.002!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Here in the megalithic Stone Circle, Eidos witnesses the new addition to the ancient tree. Swaying in the wind, Eidos recognizes the three corpses of Samesh and her children newly suspended from its branches. Silence reigns under the cloudless, gray sky until one sound pierces through the utter desolation of the scene: the muffled creak of ropes sliding on the branches as the tree's grim fruit dances in the gentle wind.

Eidos ascends the hillock, the summit giving glimpses to a curious, though familiar, sight...

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!3.002!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: The massive stones arranged concentrically as a flattened spiral, remain unperturbed by time's march, yet not unaffected. The tree at its center acts as a reminder that there once was life in this graveyard of forgotten memories. The previously strolling Samesh is now nowhere to be seen. Her presence here now too is a thing of the past.

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!7.X000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: As Eidos walks back towards the circle, she hears the hollow thundering of a woman's voice, the silence surrounding it hides that a meeting with the scant denizens of Ur'Ruk now takes place here. As Eidos approaches, the faraway rumble of Hazanna's commands gain in clarity.

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!7.X001!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Their shame shared and self-loathing reaffirmed, the Unseen file out of the Stone Circle, meek as ever. All return to the dismal task of living because another commands it so, each fighting harder than the last to hold on to the fantasy of the Form, of Aizos.

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!20.000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Having been restrained by the denizens of Ur'Ruk, Eidos is carried off to meet her fate...

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X000!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Oh, hello, sister! You must be new here. My name is Samesh."

D.response_text: "Are you hiding from something...?"

E.response_text: "Shouldn't you be working?"

F.response_text: "You look like you might be interesting!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.100!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Some respite from parenthood - raising kids can be quite the challenge, ha."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.1000!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "I generally come here to wander and think, since it's pretty quiet here - most folks really only come up here for the town gatherings, after all."

B.response_text: "What do you know about these stones?"

E.response_text: "So you're both lazy and a terrible mother."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.200!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Oh, I'm not sure anyone really knows... some say this place is older than Ur'Ruk itself - Biracul seems to have said it, or something similar."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.2000!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "I'm only here to wander and think - and to get some rest from those noisy boys of mine - because it's quite peaceful, don't you agree?"

B.response_text: "What do you know about these stones?"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.300!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Nice to meet you, Eidos. Are you here in search of a little peace and quiet also? Best place in Ur'Ruk to find it, if you ask me."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.3000!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "I come here to wander and think sometimes, since the place is generally pretty quiet - folks really only come up here during the gatherings, after all."

B.response_text: "What do you know about these stones?"

D.response_text: "Tell me of these gatherings."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.400!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Hiding? By Biracul's beard, no! Ha ha! What an odd assumption."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.4000!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "No, I suppose I'm just trying to get some solitude - since my kids can be such a handful!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.4001!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "And since this place is only rowdy during the gatherings, it's my best bet for a place to think."

D.response_text: "Tell me of these gatherings."

E.response_text: "So you are both lazy and a terrible mother."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.500!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Well, my work is taking care of my kids, but sometimes I just need some time to myself to think - don't we all, ha."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.5000!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "And since this place is generally very quiet - only rowdy during the gatherings - so it's quite peaceful, don't you agree?"

D.response_text: "Tell me of these gatherings."

E.response_text: "So you're both lazy and a terrible mother."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.600!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Me? By Biracul's beard, no! Ha ha! I'm just a simple mother trying to get by."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.6000!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "I only come up here to wander and think, since this place is generally very quiet... really only gets rowdy during the gatherings, but otherwise it's quite peaceful, don't you agree?"

B.response_text: "What do you know about these stones?"

D.response_text: "Tell me of these gatherings."

E.response_text: "So you're both lazy and a terrible mother."

F.response_text: "Lone lady wandering around a spooky ruin? You must be a necromancer, right?!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.101!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Off somewhere Biracul only knows where! You'd think they'd be easy to find with their green locks - A 'gift' of Ur'Ruk, I suppose."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.1010!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "I wonder what it is that this place is doing to them, honestly. If only I could take them to a mage to work his Truesight..."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X1011!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "But I expect they too carry the burden of our sin upon them, though they shouldn't have to live like this."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.201!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Not much I'm afraid. Radan... before his corruption at the hands of the Vile One... he had told me that they're older than the Techne used by magi - he read it in some tome, said it was Biracul who said it."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X2010!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Maybe there's some ancient magic that pulls me up here, too... But then again, maybe it's just the same jinncursed magic which damned Ur'Ruk and any who live here..."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X301!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Well, Eidos. I'm glad to make your acquaintance. I'd wish that Biracul would watch over you, but I don't think he sees us anymore. So take care of yourself, you hear."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.401!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Hazanna gathers most of our folk here and commands them to speak of each other's slights. It's a necessary evil I suppose, now that our minds are too scarred for the mage's touch."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X4010!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "However, I find it too painful to attend. A pity that my children'll have to grow up with such a harsh custom. They shouldn't have to live like this."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.501!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "I suppose I am... It's my fault that they were born in Ur'Ruk. I just wonder what it is that this place is doing to them. If only a mage could use their Truesight..."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X5010!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "But I expect they too carry the burden of our sin upon them; I just wish they didn't have to live like this."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.601!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Speaking to the dead? Now that'd be comforting."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.6010!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "I used to believe in such things. I thought our Trueflesh'd live on with Biracul in a place beyond the Graylands."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.6011!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "But not anymore. I mean, look at us! We can't even be touched by the magi anymore!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X6012!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps, we're dead already and we're just unable to rest."

F.response_text: "Heavy... I wonder if all necromancers are this depressing..."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.000!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "I wonder if it's wicked of me to feel more at peace here than I do at home with Arkash and Birarkul... you know, my two boys."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.001!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Yeah, I guess it must be. What mother would say that? But it's the truth."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.002!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "The trees here're dead. Forever dreaming. And the stones're luckier still, never had memories to pain them at all."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.003!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "You don't have kids, do you? I think Ur'Ruk is too cruel a place to raise mine... they deserve better."

A.response_text: "But with your love, I'm sure they'll be fine."

D.response_text: "...Indeed, your leaders seem needlessly overbearing."

E.response_text: "Hardship makes the weak strong."

F.response_text: "It depends. Do you have doughnuts here in Ur'Ruk?"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.100!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Love... Shouldn't a mother want what's best for her kids?"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.1000!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "The Shining One'll no longer touch our minds, here..."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.1001!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "But here in this circle, I feel I can hear the voices of the Vanquished calling out to me - and for some reason, I can sense the faintest echo of Biracul, too..."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.X1002!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "I want to give my children the peace that I feel while among these stones."

A.response_text: "You should be with your children, Samesh, not up here alone."

E.response_text: "I imagine diseased minds love company."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.1003!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "I want to give my children the peace that I feel while among these stones."

A.response_text: "You're not alone, Samesh; Nakara feels the same."

E.response_text: "I imagine diseased minds love company."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.200!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "I'm not sure. But I think I can feel the power of Old Gods here - ancient beyond measure - and I can even hear them playing among the stones with voices, raspy like dust. But strangely, I feel like the Shining One's with them..."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.2000!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Hazanna claims that Aizos is the deity of the Vanquished. That she's the form of the true Form - whatever that is. But these creatures are like... why, they're like children!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.300!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "You think so? And here I figured I was the only one who found Hazanna's teachings to be empty..."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.3000!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "All that our folk do now is blame each other for their pain, claiming it strengthens the Form. But I look inside and see only the past. A past my children'll never know."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.3001!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Here in this circle, I can feel the voices of the Vanquished calling out to me - and somehow the Shining One's with them. They're all inviting me and my kids to take our place among them..."

D.response_text: "...Hazanna speaks lies. You need new leadership."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.6001!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Hazanna says it strengthens the Form, but I don't see any strength; just the past... one my children'll never know."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.101!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Yes, you're right. I am their mother, after all and we must never be apart."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.X1010!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Thank you, sister, I know what I must do."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.X201!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Maybe you're right; perhaps it's just all in my head. I... I should be getting back to my kid now."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.401!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Yes, you're right. There're no leaders here that're fit to oversee my children; only a mage could do that properly."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.4010!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "I was wrong to speak against Pakahron... I wish I could've not been so blind back then."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!1.601!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "Yes, you're right. I am their mother after all. I'll make sure they get the peace they deserve."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!2.X000!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "I wonder if this really is the place where the Old Gods play? They'll treat us well, I hope."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!3.X000!SAMESH!.dialogue_text: "...I'll be getting back to my children now."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.000!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "We gather again at this ancient sight of sin to share our own sins, our hurts and pains. We congregate so as to expose and excise the impurities within ourselves. For just as Aizos suffered at the hands of the Vanquished, we too suffer! And just as She was trapped within the Red Tower long ago, so too are we trapped within our corrupted Falseflesh!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0000!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Just as She was cut to pieces and devoured so that the Glyphs of abomination would be learned, so too are we cut from our homes and our pasts consumed by our tormentors! And just as She was reborn, so too are we!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0001!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Our pains make us holy. Our suffering makes us worthy. Our death makes us immortal!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0002!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Speak now your hurts, so that you may see the Form that is you, the Form that resides in Aizos and rejoices with her."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X000!EGIMESH!.dialogue_text: "Greetin's... er, I mean... Brothers and sisters, Egimesh stands befer ya, sinner and sinned against. I was hurt by my wife. She..."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X001!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Brother Egimesh, you will name your tormentor."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.001!EGIMESH!.dialogue_text: "Oh, yes. I beg ya fergiveness, elder sister. I was hurt by sister Kaleko, because she's been chantin' that tune our son always loved while she was workin' the planters; and she knows how this pains me, how it reminds me of ol' Tambul, of how much I miss... miss him."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.002!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Great is the suffering of brother Egimesh! He seeks to return to his son, but know that it's not your son you seek; no, it's to be reunited with your Form! With Aizos the Many-Faced and many suffering! Bear your suffering and know she bears it with you!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X0020!HAZANNA.dialogue_text: "Sister Kaleko, you may follow. Name your tormentor."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.000!KALEKO!.dialogue_text: "Hello, brothers and sisters! Kaleko stands before ya, sinner and sinned against..."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0000!KALEKO!.dialogue_text: "But, I... I can't really name anyone."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X0001!KALEKO!.dialogue_text: "I mean, I feel quite alright, considerin'..."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.003!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Sister Kaleko, suffering is the condition of the Form. It is through pain we come to know it..."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X0030!HAZANNA.dialogue_text: "Please, for the good of Ur'Ruk, you must name your tormentor."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.001!KALEKO!.dialogue_text: "Well, like my husband, Eg... er, brother Egimesh, said, I can't stop chantin' that tune... I s'pose it's 'cause I can't stop thinkin' about Kambin..."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.004!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Great is the suffering of Kaleko! She names her son, Kambin, as her tormentor!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0040!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Once kin, but now he is nothing but one of the accusers! One of the usurpers! One of those who has been divided from Aizos!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0041!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Know that there is punishment awaiting those who cannot act as the one Form."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X0042!HAZANNA.dialogue_text: "Sister Gapa, you are next. Make known your tormentor's name!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.000!GAPA!.dialogue_text: "Brothers and sisters, Gapa stands before you, sinner and sinned against!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0000!GAPA!.dialogue_text: "I name brother Arkash! He is my tormentor."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0001!GAPA!.dialogue_text: "That little jinnspawn ran full tilt into me, sending me into the dust - Biracul cast him in shadow!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.005!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Great indeed - immense even! - is the suffering of sister Gapa! For though brother Arkash is named her tormentor, the true cause of her pain is Biracul!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0050!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Like an old spider, he spun the threads used to bind us from the embrace of Aizos, the One Truth who is Many Truths. Even now, he lives on her lips, like unwashed scum. We know him as he is! He is as ilk to the Jinn, cut of the same cloth!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0051!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "We must cast the dust of all their kind from our eyes and Selves. We must return to the One Truth, to the Form of Aizos!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X0052!HAZANNA.dialogue_text: "Now, brother Kahin, you may speak your torment and its causer."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X000!KAHIN!.dialogue_text: "Brothers and sisters, Kahin stands before you, sinner and sinned against! And I name sister Gapa as my tormentor!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0000!KAHIN!.dialogue_text: "I've heard it said that she accused me of not sympathizing with the plight of our dear sister Nakara. All here know how my heart aches for her in her fear and weakness."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0001!KAHIN!.dialogue_text: "Brothers and sisters, Kahin stands before you, sinner and sinned against! And I name sister Eidos as my tormentor!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0002!KAHIN!.dialogue_text: "She spoke words against us, against our seeking of the Form! And though it shames me to say it, her jinnwhispers caused me to doubt, caused me to wonder if we weren't hopelessly lost!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X006!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Great is the suffering of brother Kahin! He has named sister Gapa as his tormentor and objects to the pain the love of our family can bring us!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0060!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "But know when we inflict these hurts that they work to awaken the Form. The Vanquished themselves immortalized Aizos through her dismemberment. Thus, we must be thankful for such love..."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X0061!HAZANNA.dialogue_text: "Now sister Magda, speak of your torments and their provokers!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0062!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Great is the suffering of brother Kahin! Sister Eidos has but recently come from the House of Dust, though perhaps she wishes to return and take us with her!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0063!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "But we will not go! There are no answers outside the Self! There's only order and peace here, sharing in the Form! No jinnwhispers can persuade us of what is false!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0064!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "We all must guide our new family member along the path that Aizos carved for us; or we must return her to the House of Dust!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X0065!HAZANNA.dialogue_text: "But now we turn to sister Magda. Speak of your torments and their provokers!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.000!MAGDA!.dialogue_text: "Dear fam'ly, Magda stands befer ya, sinner and sinned against, and while readin' scars, brother Whabyn violated me with his lustful eye."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0000!MAGDA!.dialogue_text: "I try to treat him as brother, but he made me feel like I was a stranger in my own land, unprotected, orphaned and alone... made me fear him."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X007!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Great is the suffering of sister Magda! Brother Whabyn is her tormentor, and though he is not here to witness your pain, dearest sister, I am. We are. And so too is Aizos!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X0071!HAZANNA.dialogue_text: "Great is the suffering of sister Magda! Brother Whabyn is her tormentor, and though he is not here to witness your pain, dearest sister, I am. We are. And so too is Aizos!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0072!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Sister Eidos, I see you've joined us..."

D.response_text: "...I name Ormenos my tormentor."

E.response_text: "You're the only tormentor, you pompous windbag."

F.response_text: "Those damn gremlins! And I mean every, last one!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0074!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Great is the suffering of sister Magda! Brother Whabyn is her tormentor, and though he is not here to witness your pain, dearest sister, I am. We are. And so too is Aizos!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0075!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Eidos, I see you have joined us..."

D.response_text: "Gapa. She has been spreading rumors about me."

E.response_text: "You're the only tormentor, you pompous windbag."

F.response_text: "Those damn gremlins! And I mean every, last one!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.000!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "Uh, yes, hello brothers and sisters... I name..."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0001!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "Because I fear everything... all the time, really."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0002!NAKARA!.dialogue_text: "I just can't seem to find the strength to face myself."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.008!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Great is the suffering of sister Nakara! While her fear has caused much suffering in her brothers and sisters previously, it now causes her to fear the truth of Aizos!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0080!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Her tormentor, her own mind, is so named! Most appropriate!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.X0081!HAZANNA.dialogue_text: "Eidos, I see you have joined us..."

D.response_text: "...I name Ormenos my tormentor."

E.response_text: "You're the only tormentor, you pompous windbag."

F.response_text: "Those damn gremlins! And I mean every, last one!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.0083!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Eidos, I see you have joined us..."

D.response_text: "...I name Gapa my tormentor."

E.response_text: "You're the only tormentor, you pompous windbag."

F.response_text: "Those damn gremlins! And I mean every, last one!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.100!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Great is the suffering of sister Eidos! She is but newly among us and her Form is still hidden from her."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.1000!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "We must learn to forgive the hurts she lays upon us in her false accusations, as we are much further along in our journey toward Aizos than she."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.1001!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Now let us depart from here, brothers and sisters. Return to your tasks and do the great work that will set us all free!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.200!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Great is the suffering of sister Eidos! Always is the Form difficult to see, and how much more so to the truth-blind? So too is the tormentor invisible when it is the very jinnthought that laces her mind like a poison."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.2000!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Look to yourself, sister Eidos, and your own actions. The tormentor must be destroyed through sacrifice!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.2001!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Now let us depart from here, brothers and sisters. Return to your tasks and do the great work that will set us all free."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.400!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Great is the suffering of sister Eidos! She is so weak that she must claim to have suffered at the hands of a jinnspawn she has never met!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.4000!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Look all of you and pity her! So much does she desire our love that she will lie baldfacedly to the very ones that know the work of the Vile One best!"

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.4001!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "We see your suffering sister Eidos, and we forgive you."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.4002!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Now let us depart from here, brothers and sisters. Return to your tasks and do the great work that will set us all free."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.600!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Great is the... suffering... of sister Eidos. She is but newly among us and her Form is still hidden from her."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.6000!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "We must forgive the hurts she lays upon herself in her... madness... as we are much further along in our journey than she."

KABU!UR'RUK!STONE CIRCLE!0.6001!HAZANNA!.dialogue_text: "Now let us depart from here, brothers and sisters. Return to your tasks and do the great work that will set us all."

A.response_text: "All I heard was 'free' and 'madness'... Where do I sign up?!"

KABU!UR'RUK!THE RED TOWER!0.X000!DESCRIP.dialogue_text:
Whatever Eidos has now entered, it is not of this world. The bizarre, ineffable architecture defies all logical and physical laws, to such an extent that Eidos' mind is becoming overwhelmed with the burden of simply existing in this place.

		She just cannot endure a second longer and her corporeal form begins to unravel into a fantastic chain of orderly atoms sinking ever-deeper into oblivion. Soon to follow is her ghost, slowly dissolving in the solvent that is this place's atmosphere.

		And then, after an infinite dissolution, she is no more...

KABU!UR'RUK!THRONE ROOM!0.X000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text:
The Glyph-protected portal closes as she passes through it, leaving Eidos standing in a room bathed in eldritch light of some indefinable color. She has entered an enclosed chamber some hundred paces squared, yet nearly the entire space is occupied by a curious apparatus. Five thrones stand arranged around a circular metallic platform, each of them facing inward and toward the others. The metal seal is reminiscent of the one upon which she spawned. The thrones are stained with the charred shadows of humanoid figures, burned onto the smooth metal seats.

		In one of the walls, an artificial aperture peers out into a cavern larger than the city sprawled out above it. A greenish phosphorescence lines the cavern walls, dully glowing like the dying embers of a fire. As she scans the cavern, Eidos notices five spheres of absolute darkness hovering mid-air. Their visual appearance is rather peculiar, almost as if they were not blackened objects, but rather the utter absence of any matter whatsoever. It is thus impossible to see if they are truly convex spheres or simply concave dimples in the fabric of existence.

		Walking toward the aperture, she notices some faded writing scratched into the floor immediately preceding the metallic seal.

KABU!UR'RUK!THRONE ROOM!1.X000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Eidos stares at the patterns endlessly spiraling in on themselves in her futile attempt to decode them. Thought to word transmogrified means little when the words are unknown. Written symbols are as Glyphs, powerful when known, impotent otherwise.

KABU!UR'RUK!THRONE ROOM!1.000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text:
Eidos stares at the patterns endlessly spiraling in on themselves. Then, bringing the order of Awareness to their chaotic designs, she reads the words of an obviously trembling hand -

		"ACCOMPLISHED! THE BEGINNING OF THE ONE IS FOUND!
		GODS WERE THE VANQUISHED IF SUCH A THOUGHT WHEEL HERE TURNS,
		A COUNTER WHEEL IN ANSWER TO THE TURNINGS OF OUR WORLD.
		LIES THE EMPYREAN BEYOND THIS CHAMBER?
		CERTAINTY ELUDES MY GRASP.
		I ALONE HERE STAND, PAST AND FUTURE BEYOND RECKONING.
		WHATEVER HERE NOW BEFALLS, GLADLY THE SIN I SHALL BEAR.
		I TORMA HAVE BEEN. FORGET ME NOT."

KABU!UR'RUK!THRONE ROOM!1.002!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: With the solitude and solemnity of the surroundings, Eidos is confronted with her current circumstances. She has absorbed the demon Hel and taken Ark's burden upon her shoulders. But it is only now that she realizes the full extent of this duty. Here she will remain as Ark did before her until some unknown ally comes to perform the same service for her as she did for Ark.\n\n\t\tBut Eidos knows this is neither her end nor her beginning, it is somehow both combined. She feels her ghost gently drifting off into the sea of infinity, until she is no longer able to distinguish herself from the surrounding darkness. All that remains is the name...
